Describe diagnosis for Frozen Shoulder: Everything You Need to Know.

Diagnosis

 The diagnosis is primarily made through medical history and clinical examination.

 Clinical examination

 Reduced active AND passive mobility (characteristic)

 Especially reduced external rotation and abduction

 Pain with movement at end ranges

 Normal strength when testing within the available range of motion

 Imaging

 X-ray

 Usually normal in frozen shoulder. Used to rule out other conditions such as osteoarthritis or calcification.

 MRI

 Can show thickened joint capsule, but is rarely necessary for diagnosis. Used when uncertain or suspecting other injuries.

 Diagnosis without imaging

 Frozen shoulder can usually be diagnosed clinically without imaging. The characteristic combination of pain, stiffness in all directions, and typical disease course often provides a confident diagnosis.

Beskriv hvordan stilles diagnosen? for Spenningshodepine: Alt du trenger å vite.

Hvordan stilles diagnosen?

 Spenningshodepine diagnostiseres primært gjennom sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse. Det finnes ingen blodprøve eller bildeundersøkelse som bekrefter diagnosen.

 Klinisk undersøkelse inkluderer
 Systematisk palpasjon av nakke- og hodemuskulatur for å identifisere triggerpunkter og omhet

 Vurdering av nakkens bevegelighet

 Nevrologisk undersøkelse for å utelukke andre årsaker

 Kartlegging av hodepinens karakter, frekvens og utløsende faktorer

 Trenger jeg MR?

 Bildediagnostikk er sjelden nødvendig. MR eller CT bestilles kun ved mistanke om underliggende sykdom - for eksempel ved røde flagg eller atypisk presentasjon. Det er viktig å vite at funn som degenerative forandringer på MR er svært vanlige også hos smertefrie, og ofte ikke forklarer hodepinen.

Describe 3 common causes of thoracic back pain for Thoracic Back Pain.

3 Common Causes of Thoracic Back Pain

 Most thoracic back pain is caused by mechanical issues that can be effectively treated by a chiropractor
 Rib Joint Dysfunction (Costovertebral Dysfunction)

 The most common cause of thoracic back pain. Occurs when the joints between the ribs and vertebrae become stiff or "locked."

 Sharp pain with breathing and movement

 Point tenderness at the rib attachment

 Often triggered by twisting or lifting

 Responds very well to chiropractic treatment

 Costochondritis

 Inflammation in the cartilage connecting the ribs to the breastbone. Causes pain at the front of the chest but often related to thoracic dysfunction.

 Tender to touch at the breastbone

 Can mimic heart pain

 Worse with coughing and deep breathing

 Often self-limiting, but treatment helps

 Thoracic Facet Joint Dysfunction

 Stiffness or irritation in the small joints between the vertebrae in the thoracic spine.

 Stiff and aching pain between the shoulder blades

 Worse with extension (bending backward)

 Often related to poor posture

 Common in office workers

 Myofascial Trigger Points

 Painful knots in the muscles, especially in the rhomboids, trapezius, and erector spinae.

 Often refer pain to other areas

 Can cause headaches and neck pain

 Often related to stress and overload

 Treated effectively with soft tissue treatment

 Poor Posture and Ergonomics

 Prolonged poor loading from office work, mobile phone use, or one-sided activity.

 Forward head and rounded shoulders

 Gradual development of stiffness

 Often combined with neck pain

 Requires exercises and ergonomic measures

Describe diagnosis for Discogenic Pain.

Diagnosis

 The DISCS Criteria

 The DISCS criteria are a validated clinical tool for identifying discogenic pain. When 4 of 5 criteria are met, discogenic pain is very likely
 D - Duration: Chronic pain over 6 months, intensity at least 4/10

 I - Increased pain: Worsening with forward bending and flexion activities

 S - Sitting intolerance: Limited sitting tolerance, typically under 30 minutes

 C - Central axial pain: Deep, central pain in the midline

 S - Sustained hip flexion test: Positive test where lying on back with legs raised to 45 degrees reproduces the pain

 MRI Limitations

 MRI cannot reliably distinguish a painful disc from one that is just aging. While absence of degeneration on MRI makes discogenic pain less likely, presence of degenerative changes - which are very common in pain-free people - is not diagnostic.

Describe treatment options for Teeth Grinding (Bruxism).

Treatment of Bruxism

 

 Treatment depends on the type of bruxism and underlying causes:

 
 1. Night Guard (Occlusal Splint)

 The most commonly used measure, but important to understand the limitations:

 
 Protects the teeth from wear and damage

 Does not reduce the grinding - only the consequences

 Should be fitted by a dentist for optimal function

 Caution with sleep apnea: Can worsen the condition

 
 

 
 2. Biofeedback

 Especially effective for awake bruxism:

 
 EMG biofeedback: Teaches you to recognize muscle tension

 Awareness training: Place reminders where you often clench

 Progressive muscle relaxation: Reduces general tension

 
 

 
 3. Chiropractic Treatment

 I focus on the muscle and joint component:

 
 Jaw joint mobilization: Improves mobility and function

 Neck treatment: Upper neck affects jaw muscles via nerve connection

 Trigger therapy: Releases tender points in masseter, temporalis

 Ergonomic guidance: Screen position, posture

 
 

 
 4. Treatment of Underlying Causes

Provide a structured clinical overview of Sitting Posture and Back Pain.

The Myth of the "Perfect Sitting Posture": In 2012, pain researcher Peter O'Sullivan published an influential article in JOSPT titled "Sit Up Straight: Time to Re-evaluate." The message was clear: postural correction alone has little effect on back pain . There is no single sitting posture proven to be better than others for preventing back pain.

What Prolonged Sitting Does to Your Body: While sitting itself is not dangerous, prolonged static sitting over time can produce changes you notice. Here are the key mechanisms
Basic Sitting Principles: While no posture is "correct," there are sensible starting positions you can vary from. Think of these as a starting point - not a rigid prescription.

Sit-Stand Alternation - The Real Solution: A sit-stand desk is a highly effective ergonomic measure for office workers. A systematic review and meta-analysis (Waongenngarm et al., 2019, Ergonomics) shows that sit-stand alternation can reduce back pain compared to sitting only.

Breaks and Desk Exercises: Research suggests that taking breaks at least every 30 minutes may be beneficial for the back. Even short breaks of 1-2 minutes can make a difference.

Common Misconceptions Debunked: No. There is no documented direct causal relationship between temporary slouching and disc herniation . Disc herniation is caused by a combination of genetics, loading over time, and individual factors. Sitting "slumped" occasionally is normal and unproblematic.

Sitting in the Car - Limited Variation: Driving offers fewer opportunities to vary your posture than office work. Here's what you can do
When Should You Seek Help?: We assess mobility in the hip, thoracic spine, and lower back, treat stiffness and muscle tension, and give you exercises that counteract the effects of prolonged sitting. Individual guidance is often more useful than generic "sit up straight" advice.

Hva forårsaker Fibromyalgi med Brystsmerter?

Årsaker og risikofaktorer

 

 Fibromyalgi har ingen enkelt kjent Årsak. Tilstanden involverer sannsynligvis flere faktorer som sammen gjør nervesystemet oversensitivt. Stress og psykisk belastning spiller ofte en rolle, noe som også kan påvirke pustemønster og gi spenninger i brystrygg.

 Hva skjer i kroppen?

 Sentral sensitisering er kjernen i fibromyalgi. Dette betyr at nervesystemet førsterker smertesignaler - som et volumknapp som star på for høyt. Normale berØrelser kan oppleves smertefulle (allodyni), og milde stimuli føles intenst smertefulle (hyperalgesi).

 
 Forskning har dokumentert følgende endringer:

 
 Forhøyet substans P (smerteoverførende stoff) i ryggmargsvøska

 Redusert serotonin, noradrenalin og dopamin

 Svekket naturlig smertehemming fra hjernen

 Endret aktivitet i hjerneområder som behandler smerte (Gracely et al., 2002)

 
 

 Risikofaktorer (rangert etter dokumentasjon)

 En systematisk gjennomgang av 37 prospektive kohortstudier publisert i PAIN (Creed, 2020):

 
 Søvnforstyrrelser/ikke-restituerende søvn - sterkest dokumentert

 Tidligere hodepine og andre smertetilstander

 Depresjon

 Sykdomsatferd (overdreven bekymring for symptomer)

 Kvinnelig kjénn og middelalder (40-60 Ør)

Describe symptoms for Carpal Tunnel Syndrome: Complete Guide.

Symptoms

 The symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome are often characteristic
 Typical symptoms

 Tingling and numbness in thumb, index finger, middle finger and half of ring finger

 Night symptoms - waking up with "sleeping" hand

 Pain that can radiate up into the forearm

 Weakness - dropping things, problems with buttons

 "Electric shocks" in the fingers

 Why is it worst at night?

 Most people sleep with bent wrists, either under the head or curled toward the chest. When the wrist is
 bent, pressure in the carpal tunnel increases significantly - up to 10 times normal. This
 compresses the nerve and causes symptoms.

 Symptoms that worsen over time

 Without treatment, carpal tunnel syndrome can lead to
 Constant numbness (not just at night)

 Muscle wasting at thumb base (thenar atrophy)

 Permanent nerve damage

 The earlier treatment starts, the better the prognosis.

 Where are your symptoms?

 Condition 
 Fingers affected 

 Carpal tunnel syndrome 
 Thumb, index, middle, half ring finger 

 Cubital tunnel syndrome 
 Little finger, half ring finger 

 Cervical radiculopathy 
 Varies with nerve root, often entire arm

 Acute pain with movement or deep breathing? Rib dislocation occurs when a rib becomes locked in the

 Developmental disorder causing increased kyphosis (rounded back) in adolescents. Affects 4-8% of the

 Flat Back (Hypokyphosis)

 Too little curve in the thoracic spine can surprisingly cause more issues than rounded back.
 Especially affects people with rigid posture and can cause compensatory problems.

 Costochondritis

 Inflammation of the cartilage between ribs and breastbone. Often gives frightening chest pain that
 can be mistaken for heart disease. Common and benign condition.

 Increased curvature in the thoracic spine - from functional postural failure to structural changes.

Behandling

 

 Behandlingen av kalkskulder avhenger av symptomintensitet og fase. Fordi tilstanden er selvbegrensende, er målsetningen å lindre symptomer mens kroppen selv tar seg av kalken.

 Ergonomisk rådgivning: Tilpasning av arbeidsoppgaver i akutt fase. Se ergonomi og skulderplager

 
 

 Ståtbølgeterapi (ESWT)

 ESWT (Extracorporeal Shock Wave Therapy) har Level I-evidens for behandling av kalkskulder. Ståtbølger sendes mot kalkavleiringen for å stimulere resorpsjon og lindre smerte.

 
 KALK-studien (BMJ 2023)

 En norsk studie (KALK-studien) sammenlignet ESWT med placebo. Interessant nok viste studien ingen signifikant forskjell mellom gruppene ved 4 og 12 måneder. Dette kan skyldes at pasienter med kortere symptomvarighet ble inkludert - der tilstanden kanskje ville gått over uansett.

 Andre studier med lengre symptomvarighet har vist bedre effekt av ESWT. Behandlingen kan våre mest nyttig for pasienter med langvarige plager som ikke viser tegn til spontan bedring.

 

 Andre behandlingsalternativer

 
 Ultralydveiledet barbotage (nåling)

Describe how is the diagnosis made? for Migraine: Everything You Need to Know.

How is the Diagnosis Made?

 Migraine diagnosis is made clinically - there are no blood tests or imaging that confirm migraine. The diagnosis is based on medical history and symptoms meeting the criteria in the International Classification of Headache Disorders (ICHD-3, 2018).

 Criteria for Migraine Without Aura

 The diagnosis requires at least five attacks with
 Headache lasting 4-72 hours

 At least two of four characteristics: one-sided, pulsating, moderate-severe intensity, worsening with activity

 At least one accompanying symptom: nausea/vomiting or light and sound sensitivity

 Do I Need an MRI?

 Imaging is rarely necessary for typical migraine. MRI or CT is only relevant for alarm symptoms (see red flags), suddenly changed headache character, neurological deficits, or new headache in people over 50. Normal findings on images do not confirm migraine - they rule out other causes such as occipital neuralgia or sinus-related headache .

Describe symptoms and signs of Hallux Valgus (Bunion).

Symptoms and Characteristics

 

 Many with hallux valgus have no symptoms - it is only when pain or functional problems arise that
 treatment becomes relevant.

 
 Pain over the joint: Typically worst when wearing shoes, better barefoot

 Redness and swelling: Over the protruding joint, especially with friction from shoes
 

 Stiffness in the big toe: Gradually reduced mobility in the MTP joint. With
 significant stiffness, also consider hallux rigidus

 Metatarsalgia: Pain under the forefoot due to
 altered loading pattern

 Hammer toes: Secondary deformity of 2nd-5th toes because the big toe presses against
 them

 Gait changes: Altered foot mechanics during walking

 

 
 Progressive Condition

 Without intervention, hallux valgus tends to gradually worsen. Studies show the angle increases by
 about 1-2 degrees per year in untreated cases. Early intervention with conservative measures can slow or
 stop progression.

Skriv subjektiv del av SOAP-notat for en pasient med Vestibularisnevritt.

Vestibularisnevritt er en plutselig funksjonssvikt i balansenerven på en side av hodet. Balansenerven sender kontinuerlige signaler fra det indre Øret til hjernen om hodets posisjon og bevegelser. Når denne nerven plutselig slutter å fungere, oppstar en dramatisk ubalanse mellom signalene fra de to orene.

 Hjernen tolker denne forskjellen som intens rotasjon - selv om du ligger helt stille. Resultatet er kraftig vertigo (følelsen av at rommet spinner), kvalme og problemer med å holde balansen.

Symptoms

 Fibromyalgia causes widespread pain that often varies from day to day. With chest presentation, many
 experience
 Chest symptoms

 Pain around the sternum and rib cage

 Tenderness when pressing on the junction between ribs and cartilage

 Pain that worsens with deep breathing or stretching

 Varying location - the pain "moves around"

 Muscle tightness in neck, shoulders and upper back - often pain between the shoulder blades 

 Other common symptoms

 Severe fatigue that doesn't improve with rest

 Sleep problems and non-restorative sleep

 "Fibro fog" - concentration difficulties and memory problems

 Headache

 Irritable bowel symptoms

 Sensitivity to sound, light and temperature

Identifiser røde flagg for Biceps tendinopati: Alt du trenger å vite.

Røde flagg og differensialdiagnoser

 Det er viktig å utelukke andre tilstander som kan gi lignende symptomer.

 Oppsøk lege ved
 Plutselig "popp" etterfulgt av kraftig smerte og synlig kul på overarmen (kan være ruptur)

 Betydelig krafttap i armen

 Hovelse, rødhet og varme (kan være infeksjon)

 Smerter som ikke avtar med hvile over flere uker

 Generelle symptomer som feber, vekttap

 Ved mistanke om komplett ruptur av bicepssenen (sees som "Popeye-arm") bør du oppsøke lege raskt, selv om tilstanden i seg selv sjelden er farlig.

 Tilstander som kan ligne eller opptre samtidig

 SLAP-lesjon 

 Skade på leddlepen (labrum) der bicepssenen fester seg. Ofte vanskelig å skille fra biceps tendinopati. MR artrografi er gullstandard for diagnostikk.

 Rotatormansjett-tendinopati

 Ofte samtidig tilstede. Supraspinatus-tendinopati gir smerte mer på utsiden av skulderen, men kan overlappe.

 AC-ledd-artrose 

 Smerte lokalisert mer til toppen av skulderen. Forverres ved kroppsbevegelser (cross-body adduction).

 Subscapularis-skade

 Kan gi smerte foran på skulderen og påvirke bicepssenen sekundært (subscapularis stabiliserer biceps i rennen).

Describe an overlooked cause of foot problems for Weak Feet: The Root Cause Most People Overlook.

An Overlooked Cause of Foot Problems

 When someone complains about foot pain, flat feet, or poor balance, the usual response is to offer more support: insoles, stability shoes, or orthotics. But this can be like giving crutches to someone with weak legs - it helps in the moment but doesn't address the underlying problem.

 The Vicious Cycle

 Weak feet need support. Support makes feet even weaker. Weaker feet need even more support. The cycle continues - and the feet become increasingly dependent on external help.

 The foot is not a passive foundation that just needs to be held in place. It is an active, dynamic system with over 20 intrinsic muscles , 26 bones, 33 joints, and over 100 ligaments that must work together for optimal function.

 20+ 
 intrinsic foot muscles 

 26 
 bones in the foot 

 33 
 joints in the foot

Vurder røde flagg: 58 år mann, fått MR av korsrygg som viser "multiple degenerative forandringer, Modic type 1 endringer L4-L5, annulusruptur L5-S1". Mekanisk korsryggsmerte. Ingen nattlige smerter. Stabil vekt. Normal blodprøver.

HASTEGRAD: TRYGT

Ingen røde flagg identifisert.

Klinisk resonnering — hvorfor alarmerende MR-funn IKKE betyr kreft/alvorlig patologi:
- "Multiple degenerative forandringer" er ALDERSRELATERTE og finnes hos opptil 90% av asymptomatiske 60-åringer
- Modic type 1 = inflammatorisk vertebral endring, IKKE malignitet (type 1 = ødem, type 2 = fett, type 3 = sklerose)
- Annulusruptur er svært vanlig og korrelerer dårlig med symptomer
- Mekanisk smertemønster med normale blodprøver = ingen malignitetsmistanke

What causes Neck Pain During Pregnancy - Causes and Safe Treatment?

Causes of neck pain in pregnant women

 

 Neck pain during pregnancy is caused by a combination of factors:

 
 Hormonal changes (affects all pregnant women)

 During pregnancy, the body produces the hormone relaxin, which loosens ligaments and connective tissue to prepare the body for childbirth. Relaxin levels are highest in the first trimester, but the hormone remains in the body throughout pregnancy and for several months after delivery.

 

 
 Postural changes and center of gravity shift

 As the belly grows, the body's center of gravity shifts forward. To compensate, many pregnant women lean backward, leading to increased curvature in the lower back. This postural change propagates up the spine and affects the neck.

 

 
 Weight gain and breast enlargement

 The natural weight gain during pregnancy - typically 10-16 kilograms - puts extra strain on all weight-bearing joints. Breasts can increase significantly in size, pulling shoulders forward and creating tension in the upper back and neck.

 

 
 Sleep disturbances

 Good sleep becomes more difficult as pregnancy progresses. Many pregnant women struggle to find a comfortable sleeping position, need to get up multiple times during the night, and generally have restless sleep. Poor sleeping positions can lead to stiff and painful neck in the morning.

Describe Clicking That Disappears - Should You Worry? for Clicking, Locking and Joint Problems in the Jaw.

Clicking That Disappears - Should You Worry?

 

 Many become worried when clicking suddenly stops. Here's what it can mean:

 Harmless Causes

 
 The joint has adapted and the disc glides better

 Less stress (stress reduction, better posture)

 Natural variation

 

 Causes That Require Attention

 
 Sudden stop + limited opening = possible transition to locking

 Sudden stop + increased pain = inflammation in the joint

 

 
 Rule

 If clicking disappears AND you can open normally without pain, it's probably good. If clicking disappears AND you have problems, seek help.

 Basert på tilgjengelig litteratur kan du forvente:

Describe how is the diagnosis made? for Thoracic Outlet Syndrome (TOS): Numb Arm and Tingling.

How is the Diagnosis Made?

 TOS is known as a "diagnosis of exclusion" because there is no single test that confirms the condition.
 The diagnosis is made through thorough clinical examination and ruling out other causes.

 Clinical examination

 I use several provocation tests to reproduce the symptoms
 Adson's test

 The head is rotated toward the affected side while the patient takes a deep breath. Positive test
 Reduced/absent pulse or reproduced symptoms.

 Wright's test (hyperabduction test)

 The arm is lifted overhead in 90 degrees abduction and external rotation. Positive test: Symptoms or
 pulse change.

 Roos' test (EAST test)

 Patient holds arms in 90 degrees abduction and opens/closes hands for 3 minutes. Positive test: Rapid
 fatigue, pain or paresthesias.

 Costoclavicular maneuver

 Shoulders are pulled back and down ("military posture"). Positive test: Symptoms or pulse change.

 Important about provocation tests

 No single test is diagnostic for TOS. Many healthy people have positive tests without symptoms. The
 tests must be interpreted in the context of medical history and other findings.

 Imaging

 X-ray neck/thorax: Can reveal cervical rib or long C7 transverse process

 MRI: Assess soft tissue structures and rule out disc pathology

 Ultrasound/Doppler: Assess blood flow

 CT angiography: For suspected vascular TOS

 Nerve conduction studies: Measure nerve conduction (often normal in nTOS)

 Differential diagnoses

 Several conditions can resemble TOS and must be ruled out
 Cervical radiculopathy (neck disc problems)

 Carpal tunnel syndrome

 Cubital tunnel syndrome (ulnar nerve at elbow)

 Rotator cuff pathology, including biceps tendinopathy 

 Cervicobrachial syndrome

 Fibromyalgia

Graviditet og korsryggsmerter

 

 Gå til full artikkel om graviditet og ryggsmerter ?

 Omtrent 50% av gravide opplever korsryggsmerter (Wu et al., European Spine Journal 2004). For noen starter plagene tidlig, for andre først i siste trimester.

 
 Hvorfor får gravide ryggsmerter?

 Hormonelle forandringer:

 
 Relaxin løsner opp leddbénd og ledd å gir mindre stabilitet

 Musklene må jobbe hardere for å kompensere

 
 Mekaniske forandringer:

 
 Tyngdepunktet forskyves fremover

 Økt svai i korsryggen (hyperlordose)

 VektØkning på 10–15 kg

 
 

 Typer smerter under graviditet

 
 Lumbal smerte: Sentralt i korsryggen, ligner vanlige korsryggsmerter

 Bekkensmerte: Fire ganger vanligere. Over SI-leddene og/eller symfysen.

 Bekkenløsning: Uttalt smerte over symfysen, vanskeligheter med å gå

 

 
 Behandling under graviditet

 Kiropraktorbehandling er trygt under graviditet:

 
 Tilpasset leddbehandling

 Bløtvevsbehandling

 Bekkenbelter ved bekkensmerter

 Øvelser og ergonomiske rød

What is a stress fracture?

 

 Bone is living tissue that is constantly being broken down and rebuilt. When the load is greater than the
 bone's capacity to repair itself, a "stress reaction" - a precursor to fracture - first occurs. If loading
 continues, a stress fracture develops. This differs from acute injuries like ankle sprains.

 
 
 2-5%
 of all sports injuries
 

 
 95%
 in lower extremities
 

 
 2-3x
 more common in women
 

 
 6-8 weeks
 typical healing time
 

 

 Most Common Locations in the Foot

 
 
 
 Location
 Proportion
 Risk Level
 Healing
 
 
 
 
 2nd-3rd metatarsal
 Approx. 50%

 Approx. 10%

 12-20 weeks
 
 
 Navicular
 Approx. 15%
 High risk
 12-20 weeks

 Approx. 10%
 Low risk
 6-8 weeks
 
 
 

 
 High-risk vs. Low-risk

 High-risk fractures are located in areas with poor blood supply and high loading. They
 require stricter offloading and have higher risk of complications.

Beskriv årsaker og risikofaktorer for Spenningshodepine: Alt du trenger å vite.

Årsaker og risikofaktorer

 Det er sjelden bare én årsak. Spenningshodepine utvikles oftest gjennom et samspill mellom flere faktorer
 1. Muskulsere spenninger og triggerpunkter

 Omme knuter ( triggerpunkter ) i nakke- og kjevemuskulatur er det mest konsistente funnet. En metaanalyse fra 2022 (Pain Physician) fant at kroniske pasienter hadde betydelig økt omhet i perikarial muskulatur (SMD 1,57).

 Hos personer med kronisk spenningshodepine har forskning funnet gjennomsnittlig 3,9 triggerpunkter per pasient , mot 1,4 hos friske kontroller (Couppe et al., 2007).

 2. Stress og psykisk belastning

 Stress aktiverer det sympatiske nervesystemet og øker muskelspenningen automatisk. En studie fant at hodepinefrekvensen økte med 4,3% for hver 10-poeng økning på stressskala. Mange kjenner seg igjen i at skuldrene heves og kjeven klemmes sammen i krevende perioder.

 3. Søvnforstyrrelser

 Omtrent 50% av pasienter med spenningshodepine har søvnproblemer (Odegard et al., 2010). Dårlig søvnkvalitet senker smerteterskelen og er en selvstendig risikofaktor for kronifisering. Mange opplever derfor morgenhodepine som følge av dårlig nattesøvn.

 4. Sentral sensitisering

 Ved langvarig spenningshodepine skjer det endringer i sentralnervesystemet. Smertesystemet blir "overaktivt" - hjernen registrerer smertesignaler kraftigere enn normalt. Dette forklarer hvorfor hodepinen kan vedvare selv etter at de opprinnelige triggerne er borte.

 5. Holdning og ergonomi

 Fremoverlent hodeposisjon ("tekst-nakke") er assosiert med økt forekomst av aktive triggerpunkter og spenningshodepine. Statisk arbeid foran skjerm uten variasjon øker risikoen.

 6. Genetiske faktorer og hormoner

 Arveligheten for hyppig spenningshodepine er beregnet til 44-48% i tvillingstudier. Førstegradsslektninger har 3,1 ganger høyere risiko for å utvikle tilstanden. Hos kvinner kan hormonsvingninger også spille en rolle - les mer om hormonhodepine .

 7. Medikamentoverforbruk

 En ofte oversett årsak.

Differential diagnoses for POTS and Orthostatic Dizziness?

Viral Infection (most common)

 About 50% of POTS cases start after a viral infection - especially mononucleosis (glandular fever), influenza and COVID-19. Among patients with long COVID, 2-14% report POTS symptoms.

Physical Trauma

 Whiplash injuries , concussion and other trauma to head and neck are known triggers. There is a documented connection between neck injuries and POTS development.

Associated Conditions

 POTS often occurs together with other conditions: Hypermobile Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (25% of POTS patients), mast cell activation syndrome (MCAS), migraine (40%), irritable bowel (30%), and ME/CFS (21%).

Describe 2. Cervicogenic Dizziness (neck-related) in the context of Headache and Dizziness.

2. Cervicogenic Dizziness (neck-related)

 Dizziness caused by neck problems affects 40% of patients with neck pain. Of these, 59.7% were related to myofascial pain syndrome (muscle tension with trigger points). This often overlaps with cervicogenic headache.

 The neck contains extremely many proprioceptors (position sensors) - especially in the small muscles at the top toward the skull. When these send incorrect signals, a conflict arises between what the neck "tells" the brain and what the balance organ in the ear registers.

 
 Dizziness with head movements

 Neck pain or stiffness

 Often triggered by positions or activities

 SCM trigger points can cause both headache and dizziness

Describe symptoms for Tibialis Posterior Tendinopathy.

Symptoms

 Symptoms typically develop gradually over time, but can also occur more acutely after injury.

 Common symptoms

 Pain on the inside of the ankle - along the tendon's course

 Swelling along the inside of the ankle

 Pain with walking - especially during push-off

 Difficulty standing on toes on one leg

 Gradual flattening of the foot arch 

 Foot turns outward - "too many toes" sign when viewed from behind

 "Too many toes" sign

 When looking at the patient from behind, with advanced PTTD you will see more toes on the affected side
 because the foot has turned outward. Normally you only see the little toe and parts of the 4th toe.

 Diagnosis

 The diagnosis is made clinically by examining the tendon, foot arch and ability to raise onto toes on
 one leg. Ultrasound or MRI can confirm the diagnosis and show the degree of tendon damage.

Diagnostikk

Explain prevention for Overtraining and Overuse.

Prevention

 Prevention is far easier than treatment. With a few concrete strategies, you can train hard and smart without crossing the line.

 Periodization

 Vary training load systematically. Use a 3:1 model as a starting point – three weeks of gradually increasing load, followed by a lighter recovery week. During the recovery week, reduce volume by 40-60% but maintain intensity on some sessions. Plan your season with building blocks, not as a straight line upward.

 The 10% rule

 Do not increase total training load (volume, intensity, or frequency) by more than 10% per week. This applies especially to runners and endurance athletes. When starting after a break, begin at 50-60% of your previous level and build up gradually.

 Monitoring

 Daily: Subjective well-being (sleep 1-5, energy 1-5, mood 1-5, muscle stiffness 1-5)

 Daily: Resting heart rate in the morning (lying down, before getting up)

 Weekly: HRV trend (use 7-day average, not individual measurements)

 Each session: RPE (Rate of Perceived Exertion) – perceived effort 1-10

 Monthly: Performance test in your sport (e.g., 5 km running test, benchmark WOD)

 Sleep

 Sleep is the most important recovery tool you have. Halson (2014) documents that sleep deprivation reduces glycogen replenishment, increases cortisol, inhibits muscle protein synthesis, and weakens the immune system. Aim for at least 8 hours for athletes, consider 9-10 hours during intensive training periods. A consistent bedtime and wake time is more important than total duration.

 Nutrition

 Energy availability: Minimum 45 kcal/kg fat-free mass per day for athletes. Below 30 kcal/kg markedly increases the risk of REDs

 Carbohydrates: 5-12 g/kg body weight per day depending on training intensity. Most important around training sessions

 Protein: 1.6-2.2 g/kg per day, distributed across 4-5 meals.

 HjØrnesteinen i behandling av akillestendinopati er progressiv belastningstrening. Dette hØres kanskje kontraintuitivt ut - hvorfor belaste en smertefull sene? Forskningen er imidlertid tydelig: sener trenger kontrollert belastning for å tilpasse seg og bli sterkere.

 Veiledning i ovelsesprogrammer

 Korrekt utforelse av eccentric training eller Heavy Slow Resistance er avgjørende

 Belastningsstyring

 Finne riktig balanse mellom aktivitet og restitusjon, med gradvis progresjon

 Bløtvevsbehandling

 Behandling av leggmuskulatur og omkringliggende strukturer som supplement

 Leddmobilisering

 Vurdering og behandling av ankelledd ved nedsatt bevegelighet

 

 

 
 5

 
 Trykkbolgebehandling (ESWT)

 Kan vurderes ved kroniske tilfeller, særlig i kombinasjon med Øvelser

 

 

 

 De to gullstandard-protokollene

 
 1. Alfredson Eccentric Protocol (Sverige, 1998)

 Excentrisk haelsenk fra trappekant:

 
 3 sett x 15 repetisjoner, med både strakt og bøyd kne

 To ganger daglig (totalt 180 repetisjoner)

 Øvelsene utføres i smertesonen (0-5/10)

 Vekten okes gradvis

 
 60% suksess etter 4 måneder vs 24% for "vent og se" (Rompe 2007)

 Tre Øvelser med tung belastning:

 
 Sittende tahev, legpress-tahev, staende tahev

 3 ganger per uke

 Langsomme bevegelser (3 sek opp, 3 sek ned)

 Progresjon fra 15RM til 6RM over 12 uker

Explain treatment of headache for Headaches and Migraines.

4 Treatment of Headache

 Chiropractic Treatment

 Chiropractic care has documented effect for cervicogenic headache and tension headache with muscular component. A systematic review and meta-analysis showed moderate evidence for spinal manipulation in neck headache.

 What I Do

 Thorough examination of neck, jaw and shoulder

 Joint mobilization and correction of upper cervical vertebrae

 Soft tissue treatment of trigger points and tight muscles

 Exercises for neck and posture

 Ergonomic advice and preventive strategies

 Medical Treatment of Migraine

 Migraine often requires medical treatment from a doctor or neurologist.

 Acute treatment: Triptans (like sumatriptan) are standard treatment for moderate to severe attacks

 Preventive: Beta-blockers, candesartan, topiramate, amitriptyline

 For chronic migraine: Botox or CGRP inhibitors

Røde flagg – Når du bør søke lege umiddelbart

 

 
 Ring 113 eller oppsøk legevakt umiddelbart ved:

 
 Sterke brystsmerter som stråler til venstre arm, kjeve eller hals

 Plutselige, intense "rivende" smerter i ryggen

 Feber kombinert med ryggsmerter

 Uforklarlig vekttap kombinert med vedvarende ryggsmerter

 
 

 
 Hjertesmerter vs. ribbeinsmerter å hvordan skille?

 Hjertesmerter: Ofte diffuse/trykkende, kommer gjerne ved anstrengelse, ledsages av svette, kvalme, pustevansker. Strøler ofte til arm, kjeve eller rygg. Endres IKKE av bevegelse eller trykk på brystet.

 Ribbeins-/muskelsmerter: Ofte skarpe/stikkende, kommer ved bestemte bevegelser eller pust. Du kan ofte peke på akkurat hvor det gjør vondt. Forverres ved trykk på stedet, rotasjon eller dyp innpust.

 Er du i tvil? Det er alltid trygt å ringe 113 eller legevakt for en vurdering. Bedre én tur for mye enn én for lite.

Beskriv behandlingsalternativer for Nakkesmerter - Komplett guide til Årsaker, behandling og røde flagg.

Behandling av nakkesmerter

 

 Manuell behandling kombinert med Øvelser

 Kombinasjonen av manuell behandling og Øvelser har dokumentert effekt ved nakkesmerter. En meta-analyse fra 2023 fant at manipulativ terapi gå bedre resultater på smerte og funksjon sammenlignet med kontrollgrupper (Wang et al., 2023). Effekten er tydeligst på kort sikt.

 Hos meg på TheBackROM kombinerer jeg leddmobilisering, bløtvevsbehandling og malrettede Øvelser tilpasset din situasjon. Manipulasjon av brystvirvelsoylen kan også gi umiddelbar lindring av nakkesmerter.

 
 Hvorfor tidlig behandling lénner seg

 En studie fra 2016 sammenlignet pasienter som fikk behandling innen fire uker med dem som ventet lenger. Resultatet var tydelig: tidlig behandling ga dobbelt så stor sjanse for klinisk betydningsfull bedring på både smerte og funksjon (Horn et al., 2016). Tidlig innsats var også mer kostnadseffektivt og krevde færre behandlinger totalt.

 

 Hva kan du forvente av et behandlingsforløp?

 
 Ved akutte nakkesmerter (under 6 uker): Vanligvis 2-3 behandlinger per uke de første 2-4 ukene, deretter gradvis nedtrapping. Totalt 6-12 behandlinger.

 Ved kroniske plager (over 12 uker): 1-2 behandlinger per uke over lengre tid, kombinert med hjemmetreningsprogram.

 

 Målet er alltid at du skal bli mest mulig selvhjulpen.

 Prognose og tilbakefallsrisiko

 De fleste med nakkesmerter blir betydelig bedre, enten av seg selv eller med behandling. Det er likevel viktig å våre realistisk:

 
 50-85% av de...

Beskriv Hva er en SLAP-lesjon? for SLAP-lesjon: Alt du trenger å vite.

Hva er en SLAP-lesjon?

 

 SLAP-lesjon er en skade på den Øvre delen av labrum (leddlepen) i skulderleddet, der den lange bicepssenen fester seg. "SLAP" star for "Superior Labrum Anterior to Posterior" - altså en skade som strekker seg fra foran til bak på den Øvre leddlepen.

 Labrum er en bruskring som omgir leddfaten i skulderen og bidrar til stabiliteten. Den lange bicepssenen fester seg på toppen av denne ringen, og det er her SLAP-lesjoner oppstår.

 Klassifikasjon

 SLAP-lesjoner klassifiseres i fire hovedtyper:

 
 
 Type I - Degenerative forandringer

 

 Slitasje og frynser i labrum uten avløsning. Vanlig aldersforandring. Krever sjelden behandling.

 

 
 
 Type II - Avløsning av labrum og bicepsfeste

 Vanligst
 

 Labrum og bicepsfestet loster fra leddfaten. Dette er den mest klinisk relevante typen og den som oftest diskuteres i forhold til kirurgi.

 

 
 
 Type III - "Botte-hank"-rift

 

 En del av labrum rives av og kan henge ned i leddet som en botte-hank. Kan gi mekaniske symptomer.

 

 
 
 Type IV - Rift som involverer bicepssenen

 

 Kombinasjon av type III med at riftten strekker seg inn i bicepssenen.

 

 
 
 6%
 av skulderartroskopier
 

 
 Type II
 vanligste type
 

 
 20-40 Ør
 typisk aldersgruppe

Fordelene med kortison

 

 Kortison har sin plass i behandlingen av skulderplager. Her er situasjonene der det kan våre nyttig:

 
 Når kortison kan våre et godt valg

 
 Akutt, intens betennelse: Når smerten er så kraftig at du ikke klarer å gjøre Øvelser

 for å muliggjøre rehabilitering: Smertelindring slik at du kan starte opptrening

 Diagnostisk verktøy: Hvis injeksjonen gir lindring, bekrefter det at problemet er lokalt

 Akutt bursitt: Betennelse i slimpose responderer ofte godt

 Frossen skulder: Kan hjelpe i den smertefulle første fasen

 
 

 
 
 70-80%
 opplever initial bedring
 

 
 24-48t
 tid til effekt
 

 
 6-8 uker
 typisk varighet
 

 

 
 Kortison som "vindusÅpner"

 Den kanskje beste bruken av kortison er som et "vindu" for rehabilitering. Injeksjonen gir midlertidig smertelindring slik at du kan gjennomføre Øvelser og fysisk behandling som adresserer den underliggende Årsaken. Kortison alene uten oppfølgende rehabilitering gir sjelden varig bedring.

Describe Referred pain - pain in the wrong place for Trigger Points in Arm and Forearm.

Referred pain - pain in the wrong place

 

 The most confusing thing about trigger points is referred pain: pain is felt in a
 completely different place from where the problem is. This explains why many get the wrong diagnosis.

 
 Common referred pain patterns in the arm

 
 Extensors (top of forearm): Referred pain to elbow and back of hand - resembles tennis elbow

 Flexors (underside of forearm): Referred pain to wrist and fingers - resembles carpal tunnel

 Brachioradialis: Referred pain to thumb base and wrist

 Scalene muscles (neck): Referred pain down into arm and fingers - resembles
 radiculopathy

 Subscapularis (shoulder): Referred pain to wrist and back of upper arm

 
 

 
 Common misdiagnoses

 Because of referred pain, trigger points are often misdiagnosed as:

 
 Tennis elbow (lateral epicondylitis)

 Carpal tunnel syndrome

 Cervical radiculopathy (neck nerve root)

 De Quervain's tenosynovitis

 Frozen shoulder

Beskriv hvorfor varighet er nøkkelen til diagnosen for Når svimmelheten ikke passer inn: Er det BPPV eller noe annet?.

Hvorfor varighet er nøkkelen til diagnosen

 Den enkleste måten å skille mellom ulike svimmelhetsårsaker er å spørre: Hvor lenge varer anfallene?

 Sekunder (under ett minutt)

 Klassisk BPPV. Krystallene i øret utløser kort, intens svimmelhet ved hodebevegelser.

 Minutter til timer (5 min - 72 timer)

 Vestibulær migrene. Cirka 30% har anfall som varer minutter, 30% timer, og 30% flere dager.

 20 minutter til 12 timer

 Ménières sykdom. Anfallene kommer med hørselstap, øresus og trykkfølelse i øret.

 Dager til uker (konstant)

 Vestibulær nevritt. Akutt betennelse i balansenerven gir vedvarende svimmelhet som gradvis avtar.

 Måneder (vedvarende daglig)

 PPPD. Kronisk ustadighet som forverres av bevegelse og visuelt stimuli.

 Viktig regel

 Hvis svimmelheten din varer lengre enn ett minutt per episode, er det sannsynligvis ikke klassisk BPPV.

Differential diagnoses for Cervicogenic Dizziness (Neck?

Myofascial Dysfunction and Trigger Points (most common)

 58.5% had myofascial pain syndrome, and 59.7% of these had dizziness. Tight muscles - especially in the suboccipital muscles, upper trapezius and sternocleidomastoid - can disturb proprioceptive signaling.

Joint Stiffness in the Upper Neck

 The upper cervical joints (C0-C1-C2) contain a very high density of proprioceptive sensors. When these joints become stiff, inaccurate signals are sent to the brain.

Whiplash and Neck Injuries

 Dizziness is reported in 20-58% of patients with whiplash-associated injury.

Prolonged Poor Head Posture

 "Tech neck" - constantly leaning head forward in front of screens.

Du er en medisinsk sikkerhetsrådgiver for kiropraktikk. Identifiser røde flagg, gi differensialdiagnostikk og klinisk resonnering. Prioriter alltid pasientsikkerhet. Klassifiser hastegrad: AKUTT (ring 113), HENVIS SAMME DAG, HENVIS RUTINE, MONITORÉR, eller TRYGT.
Vurder røde flagg: 52 år mann med akutt debut av svakhet i begge bena, nummenhet fra brystlinjen og ned, og vannlatingsproblemer etter å ha løftet tungt. Kjent torakal diskusherniering.

HASTEGRAD: AKUTT — Ring 113

RØDE FLAGG IDENTIFISERT: Akutt torakal myelopati.

Klinisk resonnering:
- Bilateral beinsvakhet med sensorisk nivå ved brystlinjen = torakal medullakompresjon
- Kjent torakal diskusherniering = anatomisk årsak identifisert
- Vannlatingsproblemer = sfinkteraffeksjon (alvorlig prognostisk markør)
- Akutt debut etter løfting = mulig akutt diskusherniering
- Torakal medullakompresjon har DÅRLIGERE prognose enn lumbal CES pga. ryggmargen

Dette er AKUTT: ryggmargen tolererer kompresjon dårligere enn cauda equina.

HANDLING: Ring 113. Akutt MR torakalcolumna. Nevrokirurgisk vurdering for dekompresjon. INGEN manipulasjon. Fullstendig immobilisering av thorakalcolumna.

Hva er prognosen for Korsryggsmerter – Komplett guide?

Prognose og tilbakefall

 

 Ved akutte korsryggsmerter er 39% smertefrie etter 6 uker, 73% etter 1 Ør (Henschke, BMJ 2008). Ved kroniske smerter hadde 67,2% samme smertenivå etter 4 Ør (Peng, 2012).

 
 Tilbakefall er vanlig

 69% fikk tilbakefall innen 12 måneder (da Silva, 2019). Korsryggsmerter er derfor en episodisk, langsiktig tilstand – forebygging er viktig.

 

 
 Hva sier forskningen om behandling?

 
 JAMA 2017: Manipulasjon gå ~10 poengs forbedring på 100-punkts skala å tilsvarende NSAIDs

 BMJ 2019: Høykvalitets evidens for effekt ved kroniske smerter

 CCGPP (2016) anbefaler 6–12 behandlinger over 2–4 uker som utgangspunkt

Beskriv Hvem bor du velge? for Kiropraktor vs Naprapat: Hva er forskjellen og hvem bor du velge?.

Hvem bor du velge?

 

 
 Velg kiropraktor hvis:

 
 Du kan trenge sykemelding - bare kiropraktor (sammen med lege og manuellterapeut) kan skrive sykemelding

 Du trenger bildediagnostikk - kiropraktorer kan rekvirere MR, rontgen og CT direkte uten at du ma via fastlegen

 Du vil ha en behandler som kan handtere det meste - kiropraktorens utvidede rettigheter betyr at du ofte slipper a ga via andre instanser

 Du har nevrologiske symptomer - kiropraktorens medisinske utdanning er spesielt relevant ved mistanke om nervepavirkning

 Du onsker kortere, mer fokuserte behandlinger - kiropraktisk tradisjon vektlegger effektive, malrettede intervensjoner

 
 

 
 Velg naprapat hvis:

 
 Du onsker lengre behandlingstid - naprapater bruker ofte mer tid per konsultasjon

 Du foretrekker mye muskelarbeid - naprapatisk tilnarming vektlegger ofte blotvevsbehandling

 Du liker myke teknikker - naprapater bruker generelt mykere mobiliseringsteknikker

 Du har hatt god erfaring med naprapat tidligere - personlig erfaring og relasjon med behandler er viktig

 
 

 
 Det viktigste: Finn en god behandler

 Uansett tittel er den individuelle behandlerens kompetanse og erfaring avgjorende. En dyktig naprapat kan gi bedre resultat enn en middelmadig kiropraktor - og omvendt.

 

 Spor gjerne om:

 
 Behandlerens erfaring med din type plage

 Hvordan de vurderer og behandler

 Hvor mange behandlinger de forventer

What is the prognosis for SI Joint Pain and Pelvic Dysfunction?

Prognosis - What to Expect?

 

 
 Generally Good Prognosis

 Up to 95% of patients respond well to conservative treatment with significant pain
 reduction within 1-3 months. Most improve significantly within the first few weeks.

 

 Recurrence is common: The recurrence rate is over 30% in chronic cases. The risk
 increases if you resume strenuous activities too quickly or stop doing stabilization exercises.
 Maintenance training 2 times per week can prevent recurrence.

 Pregnancy-Related SI Joint Pain

 
 Most improve within 3-4 months after delivery

 25% still have pain after 3 months, only 10% after 8 months

 8-10% have persistent problems 1-2 years postpartum

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Weak Feet: The Root Cause Most People Overlook.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How long does it take to strengthen the feet?

 Noticeable improvements are typically seen after 4-8 weeks of consistent training. The Liverpool study showed 57% strength increase after 6 months with minimalist shoes. Foot training should be viewed as maintenance - just like any other exercise.

 

 
 Is barefoot walking safe?

 For most people, gradual barefoot walking is safe and beneficial. Start indoors on soft surfaces and increase gradually. People with diabetes, neuropathy, or reduced sensation in their feet should be careful and consult a healthcare professional first.

 

 
 Can I train my feet even if I have flat feet?

 Yes, absolutely. Research (Huang 2022 meta-analysis) shows that foot training can increase arch strength and improve function even in people with flat feet. Flexible flat foot often responds well to strength training.

 

 
 Should I throw away my orthotics?

 Not necessarily. If you have diabetes, severe deformities, or specific medical indications, orthotics may still be important. For non-specific problems, gradual weaning combined with foot training may be a good alternative. Discuss with a professional.

 

 
 Can a chiropractor help with weak feet?

 Yes. Chiropractors assess the entire musculoskeletal system and can identify whether foot problems are due to local conditions or compensations from hips, pelvis, or back. Treatment often includes joint mobilization, soft tissue work, and guidance on targeted foo...

Patient asks: "What is the difference between PIFP and trigeminal neuralgia?"

Trigeminal neuralgia causes short, intense pain attacks (seconds to minutes) along the trigeminal nerve pathways. PIFP causes persistent, dull pain that does not follow nerve anatomy and lacks the sharp attacks.

Explain what does new research say about treatment? for Concussion in Sports: When Can You Play Again?.

What does new research say about treatment?

 End of the "cocoon" approach

 The Amsterdam Consensus Statement from 2023 - the most comprehensive review of concussion research ever (78,000 studies evaluated) - turns old practice upside down.

 Previous vs. new recommendation

 Previous recommendation: Complete rest from all physical and cognitive activity until symptom-free.

 New recommendation: 24-48 hours of relative rest, then gradual return to light aerobic activity. Strict rest ("cocooning") is not beneficial and may actually prolong recovery.

 A randomized study with 103 adolescents showed that those who started controlled exercise early recovered in a median of 13 days, compared to 17 days for the group that only rested. Prolonged recovery over 30 days affected only 4% in the exercise group versus 14% in the rest group.

What warning signs should be monitored for Headache in Back of Head?

SEEK MEDICAL HELP IMMEDIATELY IF
 Sudden, intense headache ("the worst headache of my life")

 Fever combined with neck stiffness (may indicate meningitis)

 Visual disturbances, double vision, or vision loss 

 Neurological deficits such as weakness, numbness, speech difficulties

 New-onset headache after age 50 - evaluate for temporal arteritis

 Headache after head injury 

 Headache that worsens with coughing, sneezing, or exertion 

 Personality changes or confusion 

 Guidelines use the SNOOP mnemonic: Systemic symptoms, Neurological signs, Onset sudden, Older age >50, Pattern change

Describe symptoms for Osteoporosis and Compression Fractures in the Back.

Symptoms

 Here comes a surprising fact: 65-75% of all vertebral fractures give no or minimal
 symptoms (AAFP, 2016). Many are discovered incidentally on X-rays or MRI taken for other
 reasons.

 When symptoms occur, I often see
 Sudden, intense pain in the middle of the back or in the thoracic/lumbar transition - similar to thoracic back pain 

 Pain worsens with change of position, coughing or lifting

 Improvement with rest and lying down

 Gradual height loss over time

 Increasing curvature of the upper back (kyphosis) - see kyphosis 

 The typical scenario

 An elderly person, often a woman, experiences sudden strong back pain after bending down or lifting
 something light. There was no distinct fall or trauma.

 Useful clinical signs

 Two clinical signs have proven useful
 Closed-fist percussion test (tapping lightly on the vertebra) has a sensitivity of
 87.5% and specificity of 90%.

 "Supine sign" - that the patient cannot lie flat with only one pillow due to pain -
 has sensitivity 81% and specificity 93% (PMC, 2011).

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Skulderbladssmerte og Cervikal Radikulopati.

Hvem rammes?: Smerter mellom skulderbladene er svært vanlige og rammer et bredt spekter av mennesker. Cervikal radikulopati som årsak er underdiagnostisert fordi mange behandlere fokuserer lokalt uten å undersøke nakken.

Årsaker og risikofaktorer: Nervene fra nakken (C4-C8) har forgreninger som innerverer muskulaturen og huden rundt skulderbladene. Når en nerverot irriteres, kan smerten oppleves der nerven ender - ikke der problemet sitter.

Symptomer: Symptomene avhenger av om smerten er referert fra cervikale strukturer eller har lokal årsak
Diagnostikk: En systematisk undersøkelse skiller de ulike årsakene fra hverandre
Behandling: En nettverksmetaanalyse fra 2025 og en systematisk oversikt fra 2021 (10 studier) bekrefter at manuell terapi er effektiv for smerte og funksjon ved cervikal radikulopati. Behandlingen rettes mot kilden - nakken - ikke bare der det gjør vondt.

Prognose: De fleste med cervikal referert skulderbladssmerte responderer godt på konservativ behandling innen 4-8 uker . Nøkkelen er å identifisere at årsaken sitter i nakken - og rette behandlingen dit.

Describe treatment options for Meniere's Disease.

Treatment

 

 There is no cure for Meniere's disease. The goal of treatment is to reduce attack frequency, relieve symptoms and improve quality of life.

 Conservative Treatment and Lifestyle

 
 Salt Reduction

 A stable, low salt intake (<1500-2000 mg sodium daily) is often recommended as first-line treatment. The theory is that this can stabilize the fluid balance in the inner ear. The Cochrane review from 2018 found no randomized studies supporting this, but many patients report improvement.

 

 Medical Treatment

 
 Betahistine (Betaserc)

 The most commonly used medication in Europe. The BEMED study (2016) found no significant difference between betahistine and placebo, but the medication is well tolerated and is often tried for 3-6 months.

 

 Vestibular Rehabilitation

 AAO-HNS recommends vestibular rehabilitation for patients with chronic unsteadiness between attacks. A meta-analysis from 2023 found moderate effect on quality of life.

 
 Important About Vestibular Rehabilitation

 Vestibular rehabilitation is not recommended during acute attacks - it is well-documented when vertigo episodes are under control.

 

 What Can the Chiropractor Contribute?

 Chiropractors cannot treat the fluid accumulation in the inner ear itself. But many people with Meniere's disease develop secondary problems that I can help with:

 
 Neck and shoulder tension: Chronic stress and abnormal head position during attacks often lead to muscle tightness, which can cause cervicogenic di...

Beskriv diagnostikk — vanskelig, men mulig for Overtrening og Overbelastning.

Diagnostikk — vanskelig, men mulig

 Det finnes ingen blodprøve eller enkelttest som bekrefter overtreningssyndrom. Det er en eksklusjonsdiagnose — du må først utelukke andre forklaringer som lavt jernlager, stoffskifteproblemer, infeksjoner eller depresjon (Meeusen et al., 2013).

 Treningsdagbok

 Det enkleste og mest undervurderte verktøyet. Logg treningsbelastning (volum, intensitet, RPE), søvnkvalitet, humør og hvilepuls. Mønstrene over tid forteller mer enn et enkelt øyeblikksbilde. Apper som TrainingPeaks eller Polar Flow fungerer fint, men et enkelt regneark gjør jobben like godt.

 HRV (hjerteratevariabilitet)

 Redusert HRV kan indikere akkumulert utmattelse, men er ikke sensitiv nok alene (2024 SR). Ukentlige trender er mer informative enn enkeltmålinger. Mål konsistent — samme tidspunkt, samme posisjon, helst om morgenen. Kombinert med subjektive mål gir HRV et nyttigere bilde (Halson, 2014).

 Hviletest

 Hvis symptomene bedres etter 2–4 ukers hvile, dreier det seg sannsynligvis om NFOR. Vedvarer de, mistenkes OTS. Denne testen er kanskje den enkleste måten å skille gradene av overbelastning fra hverandre.

 Blodprøver

 CRP, ferritin, tyroidea, testosteron/kortisol-ratio og vitamin D kan støtte diagnosen og utelukke andre tilstander. Ingen av disse er diagnostiske for OTS alene, men mønsteret kan støtte diagnosen og utelukke differensialdiagnoser som anemi, infeksjon og stoffskiftesykdom (Cadegiani & Kater, 2017).

Describe The Most Important Examination Finding in the context of Costochondritis and Chest Pain.

Sharp, stabbing or aching pain along the breastbone, often on one side

 Worsening with deep breathing, coughing and sneezing

 Increased pain with movement of the upper body or arms

 Local tenderness that can be reproduced by pressing on the cartilage connections

 Radiation along the ribs to the back, or to arms and shoulders

 
 

 Pain can vary from mild to intense. Many describe a feeling that "something is stuck" in the chest.
 Symptoms can last from a few weeks to several months without treatment.

 

 
 
 
 5
 Diagnostics

 

 Costochondritis is a clinical diagnosis - there is no blood test or imaging that
 confirms the condition. The diagnosis is made based on medical history and physical examination.

 
 The Most Important Examination Finding

 Pain can be reproduced by pressing on the affected cartilage connections. This is called
 reproducible tenderness and is characteristic of the condition.
 

 

 When is Imaging Necessary?

 X-ray and MRI are rarely indicated for typical costochondritis. Imaging may be relevant to rule out other
 causes with atypical symptoms, prolonged course, or suspected underlying disease.

 
 Validated Clinical Tool

 Chest Wall Syndrome Clinical Prediction Rule (Gencer et al., BMC Family Practice, 2012) uses six
 factors to identify chest wall syndrome with 88.6% specificity: localized muscle tension, stabbing pain
 character, reproducible pain on palpation, absence of cough, pain that is not retrosternal or pressing,
 and no known coronary disease.

You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Identify red flags, provide differential diagnosis and clinical reasoning. Always prioritize patient safety. Classify urgency: URGENT (call ambulance), REFER SAME-DAY, REFER ROUTINE, MONITOR, or SAFE.

Assess red flags: 48-year-old male with acute torticollis after turning suddenly in car. Left-sided neck pain, reduced left rotation. Full arm strength. Normal reflexes. No headache. No dizziness. No visual disturbances.

URGENCY: SAFE

No red flags identified.

Systematic red flag screening:

✗ Vascular: No headache, no dizziness, no visual disturbances, no Horner signs → EXCLUDED
✗ Fracture: Not high-energy trauma (car turning ≠ collision), no focal percussion tenderness → EXCLUDED
✗ Infection: No fever, no night sweats, no immunosuppression → EXCLUDED
✗ Malignancy: Under 50, no weight loss, no cancer history → EXCLUDED
✗ Myelopathy: Full bilateral strength, normal reflexes, normal gait → EXCLUDED
✗ Radiculopathy: No arm radiation, normal sensation → EXCLUDED

Clinical picture: Acute mechanical torticollis.

Safe to treat with gentle mobilization, heat, NSAID if needed. Expected improvement 3-7 days.

Describe symptoms and signs of Costochondritis and Chest Pain.

Symptoms

 

 Typical symptoms of costochondritis:

 
 
 Sharp, stabbing or aching pain along the breastbone, often on one side

 Worsening with deep breathing, coughing and sneezing

 Increased pain with movement of the upper body or arms

 Local tenderness that can be reproduced by pressing on the cartilage connections

 Radiation along the ribs to the back, or to arms and shoulders

 
 

 Pain can vary from mild to intense. Many describe a feeling that "something is stuck" in the chest.
 Symptoms can last from a few weeks to several months without treatment.

Beskriv Kirurgi i kontekst av Biceps tendinopati: Alt du trenger å vite.

PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma)

 Injeksjon av blodplater fra pasientens eget blod. Evidensen er fortsatt begrenset, men noen studier viser lovende resultater for seneproblemer.

 

 Kirurgi

 Kirurgi vurderes kun når konservativ behandling over 3-6 måneder ikke gir tilfredsstillende bedring. Alternativer inkluderer:

 
 Tenotomi: Senen kuttes og får trekke seg ned (enklere, raskere rehabilitering)

 Tenodese: Senen festes på nytt til overarmsbeinet (bevarer styrke og kontur)

 

 
 Prognose etter kirurgi

 Bade tenotomi og tenodese gir gode resultater hos de fleste. Valget avhenger av alder, aktivitetsniva og kosmetiske preferanser. Tenodese foretrekkes ofte hos yngre, aktive pasienter.

Describe treatment options for Fibromyalgia with Chest Pain.

Treatment

 

 What does the research say?

 EULAR (European League Against Rheumatism) published revised guidelines in 2017. Exercise is the
 a key treatment approach with a strong recommendation. A network meta-analysis from 2024 (51 studies,
 2873 patients) showed that water exercise is well-documented short-term, while strength training is best
 long-term.

 
 Treatment options

 
 Exercise (strong recommendation): Water exercise well-documented short-term,
 strength training best long-term. 51 studies with 2873 patients document the effect.

 Massage therapy (5+ weeks): Shows moderate effect for pain, anxiety and depression.
 Myofascial release (soft tissue treatment) had the most suitable effect.

 Manual treatment/chiropractic: EULAR guidelines give a "strong against"
 recommendation for chiropractic for fibromyalgia. A systematic review (Ernst, 2009) concluded
 "insufficient evidence".

 
 

 What can the chiropractor do?

 Given the limited evidence, a consultation is primarily about:

 
 Thorough examination - ruling out other causes of chest pain

 Soft tissue treatment - gentle treatment of muscle tightness, not aggressive
 manipulation

 Exercise guidance - help getting started with adapted exercise

 Pain management - explanation of central sensitization, sleep hygiene, stress
 management

 

 
 It is important to be honest:

 Chiropractic is not a first-line treatment for fibromyalgia based on current research. Exercise and
 cognitive therapy have far better e...

Beskriv symptomer for Hofteartrose: Alt du trenger å vite.

Symptomer

 Lyskesmerte er det mest typiske symptomet på hofteartrose og har 84% sensitivitet for å påvise hofteleddsplager (Khan, BMJ, 2004). Smerten kjennes ofte dyp og verkende, på innsiden av læret eller i lyskefolden. Den forverres typisk ved aktivitet som trappegang, lengre gaturer eller å reise seg fra sittende.

 Smertelokalisasjon - 47% stråler til kne

 Hos nesten halvparten stråler smerten nedover læret, og hos noen helt ned til kneet. Dette kan gjøre det vanskelig å skille hofteartrose fra andre tilstander.

 Typiske symptomer

 Morgenstivhet som varer under 60 minutter - dette skiller artrose fra inflammatoriske leddsykdommer

 Redusert bevegelighet - det blir vanskelig å ta på sokker og sko, krysse beina, eller komme seg inn og ut av bil

 Innoverrotasjon av hoften er ofte det første som blir begrenset

 Endret gangmønster utvikler seg gradvis for å unngå smerte

 Sekundære plager

 Når du begynner å gå annerledes for å unngå smerte, kan det over tid gi sekundære plager i kne, rygg eller motsatt hofte. Endret gangmønster kan også fore til GTPS (smerter på utsiden av hoften) eller SI-leddsproblemer .

Bruk D19 for:

- Periodontale problemer

Vanlig feil: Å bruke D19 for TMD — dette er en muskuloskeletalt problem, ikke dental.

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for Vedvarende Plager Etter Hjernerystelse.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Hvor lenge varer svimmelhet etter hjernerystelse?

 For de fleste går svimmelheten over i løpet av dager til noen uker. Med vestibular rehabilitering er de fleste betydelig bedre innen 4-8 uker. Rundt 10-15% får vedvarende plager utover 3 måneder, og noen kan utvikle PPPD (kronisk svimmelhet).

 

 
 Kan kiropraktor behandle plager etter hjernerystelse?

 Ja, kiropraktorer med kompetanse på vestibular rehabilitering kan gi effektiv behandling. Kombinasjonen av vestibular rehabilitering og nakkebehandling har sterk forskningsstotte.

 

 
 Bør jeg unnga aktivitet hvis jeg er svimmel etter hjernerystelse?

 Nei, langvarig inaktivitet kan faktisk forsinke bedringen. Etter 24-48 timers relativ hvile bør du gradvis gjenoppta aktivitet tilpasset symptomene.

 

 
 Trenger jeg MR eller CT?

 Ved typisk hjernerystelse og PCS viser bildediagnostikk normale funn - skaden er funksjonell, ikke strukturell. MR/CT er indisert ved røde flagg-symptomer for å utelukke blodning eller strukturskade.

Krysset SLR

Slump-test

 Sensitivitet 84% . Utføres sittende og kombinerer nakkefleksjon med kneekstensjon.

How is Vestibular Neuritis diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 Vestibular neuritis is primarily a clinical diagnosis. The most important thing is to distinguish it from stroke in the cerebellum or brainstem, which can cause very similar symptoms. Approximately 25% of patients with acute vestibular syndrome may have central nervous system causes.

 The HINTS Examination

 HINTS (Head Impulse, Nystagmus, Test of Skew) is a three-step eye examination that, in cases of acute dizziness, has proven more sensitive than MRI for detecting stroke in the first 24-48 hours. Performed by trained clinicians, HINTS is 96.5% sensitive and 84-96% specific.

 
 Head Impulse Test

 Rapid passive head rotation while the patient focuses. In vestibular neuritis, the gaze will "slip" and must be corrected.

 

 
 Nystagmus

 In vestibular neuritis, nystagmus is unidirectional - the eyes beat the same direction regardless of gaze direction.

 

 
 Test of Skew

 Alternating covering of the eyes. Vertical readjustment indicates brainstem lesion.

Describe Three Main Categories of Dizziness for Types of Dizziness: How to Tell the Difference Between Different Forms.

Three Main Categories of Dizziness

 

 Before we get into specific diagnoses, it's helpful to understand the three main types of dizziness:

 
 Vertigo - Room Spinning

 With vertigo, you experience that you or your surroundings are rotating. There's a clear sensation of movement even when you're sitting still. This is almost always caused by problems in the balance organ in the inner ear.

 
 Typical description: "The room is spinning", "I'm whirling around"

 Common causes: BPPV, vestibular neuritis, Meniere's disease

 Often accompanied by: Nausea, vomiting, nystagmus (involuntary eye movements)

 
 

 
 Unsteadiness - Rocking or Swaying Sensation

 With unsteadiness, you feel off-balance without the room spinning. It can be described as standing on a boat deck or walking on an unstable surface.

 
 Typical description: "Like being on a boat", "I feel unstable"

 Common causes: Cervicogenic dizziness, PPPD, vestibular hypofunction

 Often accompanied by: Neck pain, anxiety, worsening in crowds

 
 

 
 Lightheadedness - Foggy Head

 With lightheadedness, you feel "light-headed", distant, or like you're about to faint. There's no clear sensation of movement.

 
 Typical description: "Foggy", "almost like I'm going to faint"

 Common causes: Orthostatic hypotension, anemia, medications, anxiety

 Often accompanied by: Palpitations, sweating, vision darkening when standing up

Symptomer

 Hovedsymptomer

 Det karakteristiske symptomet er en vedvarende oscillerende svimmelhet - en følelse av
 Gynging (rocking) 

 Vugge-bevegelse (swaying) 

 Bobbing (opp-ned bevegelse) 

 Symptomene er til stede kontinuerlig eller det meste av dagen. De er ikke ledsaget av den spinnende følelsen (vertigo) man ser ved krystallsyke (BPPV) .

 Assosierte symptomer

 Mange med MdDS utvikler tilleggssymptomer
 Romlig desorientering

 Utmattelse/fatigue

 Intoleranse for visuell bevegelse (travle omgivelser, rulletrapper)

 Hodepine - ofte migrene-lignende

 Angst og depresjon

 Kognitive vansker ("hjernetake")

 Konsentrasjonsproblemer

 Søvnvansker

 Nakke- og ryggsmerter

 Det paradoksale: Bedre i bevegelse

 Et viktig kjennetegn ved MdDS er at symptomene ofte bedres når man er i passiv bevegelse - som å kjore bil eller sitte på et tog. Men symptomene kommer tilbake - og kan midlertidig forverres - når bevegelsen stopper.

 Dette skiller MdDS fra PPPD (Persistent Postural-Perceptual Dizziness) , der symptomene typisk forverres ved bevegelse.

Forklar Cervikal Myelopati for en pasient.

Cervikal myelopati oppstår nar ryggmargen i nakken blir komprimert. Det er den vanligste arsaken til ryggmargsdysfunksjon hos voksne i den industrialiserte verden. Tilstanden utvikler seg ofte gradvis og kan gi varige nevrologiske skader hvis den ikke fanges opp i tide.

 Den vanligste arsaken er degenerativ cervikal spondylose (slitasje i nakkevirvelsoylen), som star bak over 85% av tilfellene (Nouri et al., Spine 2015; Karadimas et al., Nat Rev Neurol 2013). Tidlig gjenkjennelse og riktig henvisning er avgjorende for utfallet.

You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Provide differential diagnosis based on symptoms and clinical findings. Always prioritize patient safety.
Differential diagnoses for Shoulder?

Static muscle work

 When you hold your arms in front of you to use the keyboard and mouse, the shoulder muscles
 constantly work to stabilize. Without rest, this leads to fatigue, tension and eventually pain.

Forward-leaning posture

 Many lean forward toward the screen. This causes the head to come in front of the shoulders, which
 significantly increases the load on neck and shoulder muscles.

Raised shoulders

 Stress, concentration or incorrect desk height causes us to unconsciously raise our shoulders. Over
 time, this leads to chronic tension in the trapezius muscle. This can also affect sleep quality .

One-sided strain

 Using the mouse with the same arm all day, the keyboard too far to one side - such asymmetries strain
 one shoulder more than the other. Over time, this can contribute to conditions like biceps tendinopathy or AC
 joint arthritis .

What causes Posterior Canal BPPV: When the World Spins Backwards?

Causes and Risk Factors

 

 From Most Common to Rarest:

 
 Idiopathic (50-83%)

 No known triggering cause. The crystals likely detach due to age-related degeneration.

 

 
 Head Injury and Trauma (10-20%)

 Even mild head injury or whiplash can dislodge crystals. Traumatic BPPV has a higher recurrence rate.

 

 
 Vestibular Migraine (5-15%)

 Patients with migraine have increased risk for BPPV.

 

 
 Inner Ear Diseases (2-5%)

 Meniere's disease, vestibular neuritis, labyrinthitis.

 

 Risk Factors for Development and Recurrence:

 
 Age over 50 years

 Female sex

 Hypertension and diabetes

 Vitamin D deficiency

 Osteoporosis

Prognosis

 

 The prognosis for AC joint osteoarthritis is generally good with conservative treatment.

 
 The Positive:

 
 Most achieve good symptom control without surgery

 93% with weightlifter's shoulder improve with activity modification

 Many can continue training with an adjusted program

 Surgery has good results in those who need it

 
 

 
 The Realistic:

 
 The wear itself doesn't disappear

 Symptoms can vary over time

 Some must permanently modify training/activity

 Flare-ups can occur

 
 

 Factors That Affect Prognosis

 
 Willingness to modify activity: Crucial for improvement

 Degree of wear: Significance uncertain - many have wear without symptoms

 Concurrent pathology: Rotator cuff problems can complicate the picture

 Early intervention: Faster improvement with early activity adjustment

Describe symptoms and signs of Dizzy When Lying Down? What You Need to Know About BPPV.

Symptoms

 

 The classic symptom is brief, intense rotational vertigo triggered by specific head movements:

 
 Typical triggers

 
 Lying down in bed

 Turning over in bed (especially to one side)

 Tilting the head back (e.g., looking up into a cupboard)

 Rising quickly from a lying position

 
 

 
 Typical course

 
 Delay: 5-10 seconds after the head movement before the dizziness starts

 Duration: Typically under 60 seconds - rarely over one minute

 Additional symptoms: Nausea is common, vomiting occurs with severe episodes

 After-effect: Mild lightheadedness and unsteadiness for minutes to hours afterward

 
 

 
 This is NOT typical for BPPV

 The following symptoms suggest a different cause and require further investigation:

 
 Hearing loss or tinnitus

 Pressure or fullness in the ear

 Persistent dizziness (not just with head movements)

 Neurological symptoms such as double vision, numbness, or paralysis

Describe Types of Sports Injuries for Sports Injuries - Complete Guide.

Types of Sports Injuries

 

 Acute vs. Overuse Injuries

 Sports injuries fall into two main categories, each requiring different treatment approaches:

 
 Acute Injuries

 Result from a single traumatic event - a fall, collision, or sudden movement. Examples include ankle sprains, muscle tears, and ligament ruptures. These typically cause immediate pain and swelling.

 

 
 Overuse Injuries

 Develop gradually from repetitive stress over time. Examples include tendinopathies (Achilles, patellar), stress fractures, and shin splints. Pain often starts mild and worsens if training continues unchanged.

 

 Common Sports Injuries

 
 Muscle strains: Tears in muscle fibers, often in hamstrings, quads, or calves

 Ligament sprains: Stretching or tearing of ligaments, commonly ankle or knee

 Tendinopathies: Degeneration of tendons from repetitive loading

 Stress fractures: Small cracks in bone from cumulative overload

 Joint injuries: Cartilage damage, labral tears, meniscus injuries

A: Kliniske funn forenlig med subakromialt impingement syndrom høyre skulder. Positiv Neer test, Hawkins-Kennedy test og painful arc 60-120° støtter diagnosen. Vurder røde flagg for Vondt i Hoften? - Komplett guide.

Akutt selvhjelp: Hva du kan gjøre nå

 

 Mens du venter på behandling, er det viktig å ikke irritere vevet unoedig. Her er "brannslukkingstiltakene" jeg anbefaler:

 
 
 1
 Slik bør du sove

 

 
 Nattsmerter er sværtvanlig ved hoftesmerter, særlig ved seneproblemer på utsiden (GTPS). Når du ligger på siden, komprimeres senene mot benet - som å klemme en sene mellom to harde flater.

 
 Unngå å ligge på den vonde siden: Dette Økerkompresjonen på senene.

 Bruk pute mellom knærne: Hvis du ligger på den friske siden, holder en tykk pute fra kne til ankel hoften noeytral.

 Ligge på ryggen: Ofte den beste stillingen. Eventuelt med en pute under knærne.

 
 

 

 
 
 2
 Slik bør du sitte og stå

 

 
 
 Ikke sitt med bena i kryss: Dette strekker senene på utsiden av hoften.

 Unngå å "henge" på hoften: Når du står, fordel vekten likt på begge ben.

 Ved lyskesmerter: Senk stolen litt eller vipp setet forover for å Åpne hoftevinkelen.

Hva er prognosen for Krystallsyke (BPPV)?

Prognose

 

 BPPV er en godartet tilstand med svært god prognose. Reposisjonsmanvrer gir umiddelbar bedring hos de fleste.

 Restsvimmelhet etter behandling

 31-61% av pasientene rapporterer vedvarende lett svimmelhet eller ustohet etter vellykket behandling, selv om nystagmus og posisjonsell vertigo er borte. Denne restsvimmelheten varer vanligvis i median 10 dager og forsvinner som regel innen 3 måneder. Hos noen kan dette utvikle seg til PPPD (vedvarende postural-perseptuell svimmelhet).

 Tilbakefall er vanlig

 
 Ca. 15-23% opplever tilbakefall innen første Ør

 5-Ørs tilbakefallsrate er rundt 40%

 Opp til 50% kan oppleve ny episode innen 5 Ør

 

 Forebygging av tilbakefall

 D-vitamintilskudd hos pasienter med påvist mangel kan redusere risikoen for nye episoder. En meta-analyse viste signifikant reduksjon i tilbakefallsrate (relativ risiko 0,37).

Hvordan diagnostiseres Horisontal Kanal BPPV?

Diagnostikk

 

 Supine roll-test (gullstandarden)

 Pasienten ligger på ryggen med hodet hevet 30 grader. Hodet dreies raskt 90 grader til en side og holdes i 30-60 sekunder mens Øyebevegelser observeres. Deretter gjentas testen til motsatt side. Testens sensitivitet er rapportert til 89,5% (Barany Society Guidelines).

 
 Ved geotropisk variant

 Øynene slær mot bakken på begge sider, men sterkest på den affiserte siden.

 

 
 Ved apogeotropisk variant

 Øynene slær bort fra bakken, og den svakeste responsen er på den affiserte siden.

 

 
 Viktig rekkefølge

 Supine roll-testen bør ideelt utføres får Dix-Hallpike-testen, da Dix-Hallpike kan flytte krystaller og påvirke resultatene.

 

 
 Røde flagg - kontakt lege umiddelbart ved:

 
 Svimmelhet som varer kontinuerlig over 2 minutter (BPPV gir korte anfall)

 Plutselig hØrselstap eller kraftig Øresus

 Dobbeltsyn eller andre synsforstyrrelser

 Kraftig hodepine ulikt tidligere opplevd

 Ansiktslammelse, nummenhet eller taleforstyrrelser

 Koordinasjonsproblemer eller ustå gange

 By far the most common cause of dizziness in elderly. Small calcium crystals become dislodged in the inner ear and disturb balance signals. Typically causes brief, intense dizziness with head movements.

Describe What can you do yourself? for Trigger Points in Arm and Forearm.

What can you do yourself?

 

 You can treat many trigger points yourself with simple techniques:

 
 Self-massage technique

 
 Find the tender point by palpating the muscles

 Press with moderate force (5-7 on a scale to 10)

 Hold pressure for 30-90 seconds until pain subsides

 Gently stretch the muscle afterward

 Repeat 2-3 times daily

 
 Tip: Use a tennis ball against the wall for hard-to-reach points in the upper arm.

 

 Preventive measures

 
 Take breaks: Regular micro-breaks during repetitive work

 Stretch: Daily stretching exercises for forearm muscles

 Ergonomics: Correct work position at computer

 Warm up: Before physical activity involving arms

 Stress management: Stress increases muscle tension

Describe symptoms for Trigeminal Neuralgia.

Symptoms

 The pain of trigeminal neuralgia is unmistakable to those who experience it. There are characteristic features that distinguish TN from other types of facial pain.

 Typical pain attack

 Characteristics of TN pain

 Quality: Electric shock, stabbing, lightning-like - like a bolt of lightning through the face

 Duration: Seconds to two minutes per attack - rarely longer

 Intensity: Extreme. Most patients rate 8-10 out of 10 on the pain scale

 Side: Always unilateral - the pain never crosses the midline

 Refractory period: Brief pain-free interval after each attack

 Between attacks: Most people are completely pain-free. The pain typically does not wake from sleep

 Trigger zones and precipitating factors

 A hallmark of TN is that light touch of specific areas triggers pain attacks. It is the light touch - not pressure - that is the problem. Common triggers include
 Brushing teeth or washing the face

 Eating, drinking, or talking

 Shaving

 Wind against the cheek

 Smiling

 Touching the nasolabial fold (from the nose to the corner of the mouth - the most common trigger zone)

 Atypical trigeminal neuralgia

 Some people develop a more constant background pain in addition to the brief attacks. This variant often has a burning character and is more difficult to treat than the classic form.

 Bilateral pain - a red flag

 TN almost always affects only one side. Bilateral TN (both sides) is rare - under 5% of cases - and should raise suspicion of multiple sclerosis (StatPearls 2024).

Differensialdiagnoser ved Occipital nevralgi?

Muskelspenninger og triggerpunkter (Vanligst)

 Stramme muskler i øvre nakke kan komprimere occipitalnervene der de passerer gjennom muskulaturen. Særlig semispinalis capitis, trapezius og sternocleidomastoideus. Les mer om triggerpunkter og hodepine .

Describe symptoms and signs of Sciatica: Everything You Need to Know.

Symptoms of True Sciatica

 

 Classic symptoms include pain from the lower back/buttock, down the back of the thigh, below the knee,
 potentially to the foot and toes. The pain pattern depends on which nerve root is affected:

 
 L4 root

 
 Pain to the front of the thigh and inner calf

 Weakened knee extension

 
 

 
 L5 root (L4-L5 herniation)

 
 Pain to the outer calf and top of the foot

 Weakened toe dorsiflexion

 
 

 
 S1 root (L5-S1 herniation)

 
 Pain to the back of the calf and outer foot

 Weakened toe plantar flexion, reduced Achilles reflex

 
 

 Pain quality and provocation

 
 Pain quality: Sharp, burning, electric. Often described as "current" through the leg.
 

 Worsening: Coughing, sneezing, straining, sitting, forward bending typically
 increases pain.

 Relief: Lying on your back with bent knees, gentle movement.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Osteitis Pubis - Chiropractor in Oslo.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can I exercise with osteitis pubis?

 Yes, but you should modify your training. Avoid activities that provoke pain
 (kicking, jumping, rapid direction changes). Swimming, cycling and upper body strength training can
 often be continued. Gradual increase in loading under guidance is key to successful rehabilitation.
 

 

 
 How long does it take to recover?

 With structured rehabilitation, most return to full activity within 3-6 months. Without active treatment, symptoms can last 8-12 months or longer.

 

 
 Can a chiropractor help with osteitis pubis?

 Yes. Chiropractors can offer manual treatment of pelvic and hip joints, soft tissue treatment and individually tailored exercise programs. Many patients report good results from multimodal chiropractic treatment combined with rehabilitation exercises.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Plantar Fasciopathy.

What is Plantar Fasciopathy?: The suffix -itis means inflammation, but histological studies actually show absence of
 inflammatory cells in the tissue. What happens is degenerative changes: breakdown of collagen
 fibers, thickening of the fascia, and reduced blood supply. Therefore, many professionals now use the term
 plantar fasciopathy - a more precise description of what is actually happening in the tissue (Riel et al.,
 BJSM 2017).

Symptoms: The most characteristic symptom is intense heel pain with the first steps in the morning 
 - so-called start-up pain. The pain occurs because the plantar fascia contracts during the night while the
 foot rests, and the sudden loading when standing up causes stretching pain.

Causes and Risk Factors: Research has identified several risk factors, ranked by how strongly they affect the chance of developing
 the condition
The Heel Spur Myth: Fact: This is not correct. Studies show
Treatment: Conservative treatment is the first choice, and over 80-90% respond well to this
 (StatPearls 2024). Only 5-10% eventually need surgical treatment.

Prognosis and Expected Course: Plantar fasciopathy generally has a good prognosis. 80-90% improve significantly with
 conservative treatment within 12 months.

Patient asks: "What is the prognosis after surgery for cervical myelopathy?"

Surgery leads to improvement in 60-80% of patients according to AO Spine data. The prognosis is better the earlier surgery is performed. Patients with severe and long-standing compression have poorer outcomes. The NORspine registry in Norway shows that most patients experience functional improvement, but complete restoration to normal function is not always possible.
