Describe What is BPPV (Crystal Disease)? for Dizzy When Lying Down? What You Need to Know About BPPV.

What is BPPV (Crystal Disease)?

 

 The condition is benign - it is not caused by serious illness - but can be very bothersome and significantly affect daily life.

 
 How common is it?

 BPPV affects around 2.4% of the population during their lifetime. In Norway, this corresponds to approximately 80,000 new cases each year. The condition is most common in people over 50 years old, and women are affected twice as often as men.

 By age 80, up to 10% of the population has experienced at least one episode. A Norwegian registry study showed that dizziness accounts for nearly 1% of all long-term sick leave.

Beskriv diagnostikk for POTS og Ortostatisk Svimmelhet.

Diagnostikk

 Diagnosekriterier (Heart Rhythm Society 2015)

 For å fa diagnosen POTS må du oppfylle
 Pulsokning på >=30 slag/min (>=40 for 12-19 år) innen 10 minutter etter å ha reist deg

 Eller puls over 120 slag/min ved standing

 Fraver av ortostatisk hypotensjon (blodtrykksfall >=20 mmHg)

 Symptomer har vart i mer enn 3 måneder

 Ingen annen tilstand som forklarer symptomene

 Aktiv statest (kan gjøres på klinikk)

 En enkel test: Du ligger flatt i 5-10 minutter, puls og blodtrykk males, du reiser deg og star rolig, og malinger gjøres etter 1, 3, 5 og 10 minutter. Pulsokning >=30 uten blodtrykksfall tyder på POTS.

 Røde flagg - søk lege umiddelbart ved
 Brystsmerter eller trykk i brystet

 Alvorlig kortpustethet

 Gjentatte besvimelser

 Uregelmessig hjerterytme

 Symptomer som forverres raskt

 Nevrologiske symptomer (synstap, talevansker, ensidig svakhet)

 POTS i seg selv er ikke farlig, men symptomene kan ligne andre tilstander som krever akutt behandling.

 Det Viktigste Prinsippet: Sentralisering vs. Periferialisering

 
 Sentralisering: Smerten trekker seg fra benet og tilbake mot ryggen. Dette er et godt tegn!

 Periferialisering: Smerten sprer seg lengre ned i benet. Stopp og prøv en annen tilnærming!

Describe How the Balance System Gets Involved for The Connection Between Jaw, Neck and Dizziness.

How the Balance System Gets Involved

 

 The balance system (the vestibular system) also has direct connections to the upper neck. The same cervical vertebrae that participate in the trigeminocervical complex send proprioceptive signals (position sense) directly to the balance nuclei in the brainstem.

 The suboccipital muscles (the small muscles at the top of the neck) have the highest concentration of position sense cells in the entire body - 242 muscle spindles per gram compared to only 2.2 per gram in the trapezius.

 When these muscles are tense or dysfunctional, signals to the brain can become disturbed. The result is a sensory mismatch - the brain receives conflicting information from eyes, ears, and neck, and this is experienced as dizziness.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for FAI - Hip Impingement.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 What is the difference between cam and pincer?

 Cam FAI is caused by a bump on the femoral head impinging
 against the socket. Pincer FAI is caused by the socket extending too far out. Cam is
 most common in men, pincer in women. most have a combination (mixed type).

 

 
 Does FAI need surgery?

 No, most people with FAI do not need surgery. The UK FASHIoN
 study showed that physical therapy was almost as effective as surgery after 12
 months. Surgery is considered only after 3-6 months without sufficient improvement
 from conservative treatment.

 

 
 Can I continue to exercise?

 Yes, but with modifications. Avoid exercises that cause pain,
 especially deep squats and extreme hip positions. Many activities can continue with
 modifications. Hip strength training is actually important for improvement.

 

 
 Will FAI lead to osteoarthritis?

 FAI is a risk factor for hip
 osteoarthritis, but most do not develop osteoarthritis. Good muscle strength
 and control can reduce risk. It is unclear if treatment prevents osteoarthritis
 long-term.

 

 
 Why did I get FAI?

 FAI morphology typically develops in adolescence during bone
 growth. Genetics play a role, and intensive sports in adolescence (especially
 soccer, hockey, dance) can affect hip shape. It's not something you "did wrong".

Describe treatment options for Stress Neck and Trigger Points.

Treatment

 

 
 What can the chiropractor do?

 A network meta-analysis from 2024 shows that manual therapy provides short-term improvement in pain, pressure sensitivity and function for trigger points. Treatment includes:

 
 Ischemic compression: Sustained pressure on the trigger point

 Dry needling: Thin needles in the trigger point

 Mobilization: Soft tissue treatment and joint movement

 Exercise-based rehabilitation: The most important thing for lasting improvement

 
 

 
 What can you do yourself?

 
 Strength training: Neck/shoulder strength exercises 2-3 times per week have moderate to good evidence for pain relief

 Stretching: Hold each stretch for 30 seconds - this is optimal duration according to research

 Breathing techniques: Diaphragmatic breathing (belly breathing) activates the vagus nerve which dampens the stress response

 Ergonomics: Screen at eye level, forearms supported, regular breaks

 
 

 
 For lasting improvement, you should combine treatment with strength training and stress management. Short-term effects of treatment are well documented.

Describe types of joint sounds for Clicking, Locking and Joint Problems in the Jaw.

Types of Joint Sounds

 There are several types of sounds from the jaw joint, and they mean different things
 1. Clicking (Click)

 A clear, distinct sound - like "clicking" your fingers
 Often happens when opening, but can also occur when closing

 Caused by the disc "jumping" back into place

 Opening click: The disc reduces (returns) when opening

 Closing click: The disc displaces again when closing

 Reciprocal clicking: Click both when opening and closing (most common)

 What Painless Clicking Means

 If you have clicking without pain, it means the disc is probably slightly displaced, but the joint adapts and functions normally. No reason for concern or treatment.

 2. Crepitation (Grinding/Scraping)

 A continuous, raspy sound - like sand between fingertips
 May indicate wear in the joint surface (osteoarthritis)

 More common in older people

 Not necessarily painful

 Can be stable over a long time

 3. Popping (Sudden Snap)

 Loud, sudden sound - like cracking a finger

 Often caused by cavitation (gas bubble in joint fluid)

 Usually harmless

 Yes, stress is one of the most important triggers for tension headache. Stress often leads to increased tension in neck and shoulder muscles, which in turn can cause pain in the back of the head.

 

 
 When should I see a chiropractor for headache?

 You can see a chiropractor for headache that you suspect comes from the neck or muscles - that is, when the pain worsens with neck movements, sedentary work, or muscle tension. For sudden, severe headache or neurological symptoms, you should contact a doctor first.

 

 
 How long does it take for treatment to help?

 Most people notice some improvement within the first 2-4 weeks. For cervicogenic headache, research shows that optimal effect is achieved after 12-18 treatments over 3-6 months. The effect is best maintained with home exercises.

 

 
 Is headache in the back of the head dangerous?

 The vast majority of cases are due to benign causes such as muscle tension or neck problems. Sudden, intense headache, headache with fever and neck stiffness, or new-onset headache in people over 50 should always be evaluated by a doctor.

 

 
 Does exercise help headache in the back of the head?

 Yes, specific exercises for neck muscles have good documentation. Chin tucks and deep neck flexor training can reduce both the frequency and intensity of headache over time.

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for C6-C7 Diskprolaps: Nummenhet i langfingeren.

Symptomer ved C6-C7 prolaps

 

 Symptomene ved C6-C7 prolaps følger C7-nervens forsyningsområde og er ofte mer distinkte enn ved andre nivåer.

 
 Typiske C7-symptomer

 
 Smerte: Strøler fra nakke og skulder, ned baksiden av overarmen til langfingeren

 Nummenhet/prikking: Langfingeren er mest rammet, kan inkludere deler av peke- og ringfinger

 Svakhet: Triceps (vansker med å strekke albuen mot motstand), fingerfleksjon

 Refleksendring: Redusert eller fravårende tricepsrefleks

 
 

 Det klassiske smerteprofilen

 C7-radikulopati har et karakteristisk mønster:

 
 Smertens forløp

 
 Starter ofte med nakkestivhet eller hodepine

 Utvikler seg til skuldersmerte over dager til uker

 Strøler gradvis nedover armen til handen

 Nummenhet i fingre kommer gjerne sist

 
 

 Forverrende og lindrende faktorer

 
 Forverres typisk av:

 
 Å vri hodet mot den affiserte siden

 Bakover-bøyning av nakken (ekstensjon)

 Hosting, nysing eller pressing

 Langvarig stillesitting med fremskutt hode

 
 

 
 Lindres typisk av:

 
 Å legge handen på hodet (Bakody's tegn)

 Lett nakkebøyning fremover

 Å støtte armen på en pute

 Bevegelse og forsiktig aktivitet

Beskriv årsaker - fra vanligst til sjeldnest for Svimmel når du står opp.

Årsaker - fra vanligst til sjeldnest

 1. Ortostatisk hypotensjon (blodtrykksfall ved reising)

 Dette er den vanligste årsaken totalt sett, og utgjør rundt 42% av alle ortostatiske svimmelhetskasus (kardiovaskulær etiologi). Når du reiser deg, samler 500-1000 ml blod seg i beina på grunn av tyngdekraften. Normalt kompenserer kroppen ved å øke pulsen og trekke sammen blodårene. Ved ortostatisk hypotensjon svikter disse mekanismene, og hjernen får midlertidig for lite blod.

 Hvem rammes oftest? Eldre over 65 år, personer som tar blodtrykksmedisiner, diabetikere (24% forekomst), og Parkinson-pasienter (30-40% forekomst).

 Typiske symptomer: Ørhet og ustøhet som oppstår sekunder til minutter etter at du reiser deg. Mange opplever at synet "gråner" eller får tunnelsyn. Symptomene forsvinner når du setter deg ned igjen. Viktig: Symptomene skjer aldri når du ligger flatt.

 2. Krystallsyke (BPPV)

 BPPV er den vanligste vestibulære årsaken til posisjonsvertigo. Livstidsprevalensen er 2,4% (von Brevern 2007), og BPPV utgjør 17-42% av diagnosene ved balanselaboratorier. Kvinner rammes dobbelt så ofte som menn.

 BPPV skyldes at små kalsiumkrystaller i det indre øret løsner og havner i buegangene. Dette sender falske rotasjonssignaler til hjernen.

 Typiske symptomer: Intens følelse av at rommet spinner. Episodene varer typisk 10-60 sekunder og utløses av hodebevegelser - inkludert når du snur deg i sengen. Kvalme er vanlig.

 3. Medikamentbivirkninger

 Over 250 medikamenter kan forårsake ortostatisk hypotensjon. De viktigste inkluderer
 Alfablokkere gir høyest risiko

 Trisykliske antidepressiva gir seks ganger økt risiko

 Vanndrivende medisiner

 Alle typer blodtrykksmedisin

 Forekomst etter aldersgruppe

 Aldersgruppe 
 Forekomst 

 Under 50 år 
 ~5% 

 60+ år 
 22% 

 Over 70 år 
 30% 

 Sykehjemsbeboere 
 24-50%

What is cervicogenic dizziness?

 Cervicogenic dizziness is caused by neck problems and affects about 40% of patients with neck pain. The neck contains many proprioceptors, and when these send incorrect signals, a conflict arises between the neck and the balance organ in the ear.

Hvordan diagnostiseres Bittfeil og Kjevesmerter - Myter vs Fakta?

Diagnostikk

 

 TMD diagnostiseres primert gjennom klinisk undersøkelse. Kiropraktoren vil underske kjeveleddet, tyggemusklene, nakken og hodets bevegelse. Gapeevne males, og vi lytter etter lyder fra leddet.

 Bildediagnostikk (MR/røntgen) er sjelden nødvendig ved typiske TMD-symptomer. Studier viser at bildefunn ofte ikke korrelerer med symptomer - mange uten plager har "unormale" funn på MR, og mange med plager har normale bilder. Klinisk undersøkelse er derfor viktigere enn bilder i de fleste tilfeller.

 
 Når er bilder aktuelle?

 Bilder kan vare aktuelle ved mistanke om strukturelle forandringer, etter traume, eller hvis konservativ behandling ikke gir effekt over tid.

Explain Shoulder Pain and Sleep: How to Sleep Better to a patient.

Few things are as frustrating as lying awake night after night due to shoulder pain. You toss and turn,
 but no matter what position you lie in, it throbs and aches. Lack of sleep makes the pain feel even
 worse the next day - a vicious cycle many can relate to.

 Night pain is actually one of the most common symptoms of shoulder conditions like rotator cuff
 problems, calcific tendinitis and frozen shoulder. These common
 forms of shoulder pain can significantly disrupt sleep. The good
 news is that there are concrete measures that can help you sleep better.

 In this article, you will get practical tips on sleeping positions, pillow placement,
 and what you can do before and after bedtime to reduce shoulder pain at night.

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for Brystryggsmerter.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Hva er de vanligste Årsakene til brystryggsmerter?

 De vanligste Årsakene er muskulære spenninger (særlig mellom skulderbladene), leddysfunksjon i brystvirvlene, ribbeinslasning, kostokondritt, og
 holdningsrelaterte problemer som krum rygg. I sjeldne tilfeller kan det
 skyldes mer alvorlige tilstander som thorakalt prolaps som krever
 utredning.

 

 
 Kan brystryggsmerter komme fra hjertet?

 Ja, brystsmerter kan i noen tilfeller våre hjerterelatert, særlig hos kvinner der
 symptomene ofte er atypiske. Ved plutselig smerte kombinert med pustevansker, kvalme, utstråling til arm
 eller kaldsvette bør du søke akutt hjelp.

 

 
 Kan kiropraktor hjelpe mot brystryggsmerter?

 Ja, kiropraktisk behandling har moderat til god evidens for thorakale plager.
 Manuell behandling kombinert med målrettede Øvelser gir ofte gode resultater. De fleste opplever bedring
 innen 4-6 uker.

 

 
 Når bør jeg oppsøke lege for brystryggsmerter?

 Søk lege ved: plutselig intens smerte, smerter som stråler til brystet eller
 armen, pustevansker, feber, uforklarlig vekttap, nattsmerter som vekker deg, eller smerter etter traume.
 Også ved symptomer som nummenhet eller svakhet i bena.

Explain Thoracic Back Pain to a patient.

The thoracic spine consists of 12 vertebrae (T1-T12) and is the most stable part of the spinal column. Unlike the neck and lower back, the thoracic spine is attached to the ribs, providing extra support but also being a source of pain when the joints become dysfunctional.

 Thoracic back pain is more common than many think, but often receives less attention than neck and lower back pain. The pain can vary from aching stiffness between the shoulder blades to sharp, stabbing pain radiating around the ribs.

Beskriv årsaker til nakkesmerter hos gravide for Nakkesmerter i Svangerskapet.

Årsaker til nakkesmerter hos gravide

 Nakkesmerter i svangerskapet skyldes en kombinasjon av faktorer
 Hormonelle endringer (rammer alle gravide)

 Under svangerskapet produserer kroppen hormonet relaxin , som løsner opp leddbånd og bindevev for å forberede kroppen på fødsel. Relaxin-nivåene er høyest i første trimester, men hormonet blir værende i kroppen gjennom hele svangerskapet og flere måneder etter fødsel.

 Holdningsendringer og tyngdepunktsforskyvning

 Etter hvert som magen vokser, forskyves kroppens tyngdepunkt fremover. For å kompensere lener mange gravide seg bakover, noe som fører til økt svai i korsryggen. Denne holdningsendringen forplanter seg oppover i ryggsøylen og påvirker nakken.

 Vektøkning og brystforstørrelse

 Den naturlige vektøkningen i svangerskapet - typisk 10-16 kilo - legger ekstra press på alle vektbærende ledd. Brystene kan øke betraktelig i størrelse, noe som trekker skuldrene fremover og skaper spenninger i øvre rygg og nakke.

 Søvnforstyrrelser

 God søvn blir vanskeligere utover i svangerskapet. Mange gravide sliter med å finne en komfortabel sovestilling, må opp flere ganger om natten, og har generelt urolig søvn. Dårlige soveposisjoner kan føre til stiv og smertefull nakke om morgenen.

Describe symptoms - more than just appearance for Kyphosis and Poor Posture.

Symptoms - More Than Just Appearance

 Kyphosis isn't just about how you look. Many people experience a range of symptoms they don't connect to
 their posture
 Neck and Shoulder Problems

 Increased thoracic curvature forces the head forward to maintain horizontal gaze. This overloads neck
 muscles and joints, which can lead to pain between the shoulder
 blades . Research shows that forward head posture mediates the relationship between thoracic kyphosis
 and reduced neck mobility. Granito et al. (2012) documented that reduced thoracic mobility correlated with
 23% reduced shoulder mobility.

 Headaches

 Watson and Trott (1993) found that 83% of patients with cervicogenic headache had increased thoracic
 kyphosis (>40 degrees). A 2023 study on migraine patients showed significantly higher kyphosis angle
 (57 degrees vs 38 degrees) compared to healthy controls. The headache often comes from overloaded neck
 structures compensating for the thoracic curvature.

 Arm Pain and Numbness

 A stiff thoracic spine can affect shoulder blade position and nerve function. One study found that 78% of
 cases with tennis elbow or golfer's elbow had concurrent stiff thoracic spine. Numbness and tingling in
 the hands can be caused by compression or stretch of nerves in the kinetic chain.

 Fatigue and Reduced Function

 Holding the body upright against a curved back requires constant muscle work. Many experience unexplained
 fatigue. With severe kyphosis, lung function can be affected because the chest is compressed. For more on
 the connection between breathing and the back, see breathing, stress
 and back .

Patient asks: "What is Heavy Slow Resistance?"

HSR is an exercise program where you perform heavy strength exercises with slow

 eccentric training.

Beskriv symptomer for Thorakalt diskusprolaps.

Symptomer

 Symptombildet varierer avhengig av om prolapset presser på nerverotter, ryggmarg eller begge deler.

 Vanligste symptomer

 Ryggsmerter: Opptrer hos 92 % av pasienter med symptomatisk thorakalt prolaps (PMC, 2025). Se også brystryggsmerter for andre årsaker.

 Radikular smerte: Belte- eller bandformet smerte som følger et ribbemellemrom, og kan ligne ribbeinslasning . Forekommer hos ca. 52 %.

 Sensoriske forstyrrelser: Nummenhet, prikking eller endret følesans i bryst, mage eller ben (59 %).

 Motoriske utfall: Svakhet, spesielt i ben (37 %).

 Diagnostisk forsinkelse

 Fordi symptomene kan ligne hjerte-, lunge- eller magesykdom (inkludert kostokondritt ), tar det i gjennomsnitt 14-16 måneder fra symptomdebut til riktig diagnose (European Spine Journal, 2012).

 Myelopati (ryggmargspåvirkning)

 Hos symptomatiske pasienter utvikler ca. 70 % myelopati - påvirkning av selve ryggmargen (Barrow Neurological Institute, 2024). Dette skyldes at ryggmargskanalen i brystryggen er spesielt trang, og at 70 % av thorakale prolapser er forkalkede (StatPearls, 2024).

Differensialdiagnoser ved Spondylolistese: Glidning av virvler?

1. Istmisk spondylolistese

 Vanligst 

 Skyldes en defekt eller brudd i pars interarticularis (spondylolysis). Vanligst hos unge idrettsutøvere, særlig i idretter med mye ekstensjon og rotasjon som turn, bryting og vektløfting.

2. Degenerativ spondylolistese

 Vanligst hos eldre 

 Oppstar på grunn av aldersrelatert slitasje i fasettledd og mellomvirvelskiver. Vanligst hos personer over 50 år, særlig kvinner, og forekommer typisk på L4-L5 nivå.

3. Dysplastisk (medfådt) spondylolistese

 Skyldes en medfådt misdannelse i virvelen som gir ustabilitet. Oppdages ofte i barndom eller ungdom.

4. Traumatisk spondylolistese

 Oppstar etter akutt skade eller brudd i virvelen. Kan skyldes ulykker, fall eller idrettsskader.

5. Patologisk spondylolistese

 Skyldes sykdom som svekker benvevet, for eksempel osteoporose, infeksjon eller tumor.

Describe treatment options for Calcific Tendinitis: Everything You Need to Know.

Treatment

 

 Treatment of calcific tendinitis depends on symptom intensity and phase. Because the condition is
 self-limiting, the goal is to relieve symptoms while the body takes care of the calcium itself.

 Conservative treatment (first choice)

 
 What can the chiropractor/physiotherapist do?

 
 Manual therapy: Mobilization of shoulder and thoracic spine

 Soft tissue treatment: Work on tight muscles around the shoulder

 Exercise guidance: Tailored exercises to maintain mobility and strength

 Ergonomic advice: Adaptation of work tasks during acute phase. See ergonomics and shoulder problems

 
 

 Shockwave Therapy (ESWT)

 ESWT (Extracorporeal Shock Wave Therapy) has Level I evidence for treating calcific
 tendinitis. Shock waves are sent toward the calcium deposit to stimulate resorption and relieve pain.
 

 
 The KALK Study (BMJ 2023)

 A Norwegian study (the KALK study) compared ESWT with placebo. Interestingly, the study showed no
 significant difference between groups at 4 and 12 months. This may be because patients with shorter
 symptom duration were included - where the condition might have resolved anyway.

 Other studies with longer symptom duration have shown better effect of ESWT. The treatment may be
 most useful for patients with long-term symptoms that show no signs of spontaneous improvement.

 

 Other treatment options

 
 Ultrasound-guided barbotage (needling)

 A needle is inserted into the calcium deposit under ultrasound guidance. Calcium slur...

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Flat Rygg.

Hvem rammes?: Hypokyfose og Straight Back Syndrome har et tydelig aldersmønster. En gjennomgang av 114 SBS-pasienter viste at 95% var under 40 år, og 60% var mellom 20 og 40 år (Jiang & Li, referert i Kong et al., World Journal of Cardiology, 2023). Tilstanden ser ut til å bli sjeldnere med alderen.

Symptomer å mer enn bare ryggsmerter: Det som gjør hypokyfose og spesielt Straight Back Syndrome utfordrende er symptomene som kan forveksles med hjertesykdom.

Diagnostikk: En erfaren kliniker kan ofte se og føle en flat rygg ved undersøkelse. Brystkassen kan virke smal sett fra siden (redusert foran-bak-diameter).

Behandling: Behandling av hypokyfose er IKKE det samme som behandling av vanlige ryggsmerter eller krum rygg.

Kontraindikasjoner å hvem bør IKKE ha denne behandlingen: En studie fra Mayo Clinic (Sinaki & Mikkelsen, 1984) undersøkte 59 postmenopausale kvinner med ryggosteoporose
Røde flagg å når du bør søke lege: Ved Straight Back Syndrome har 58-67% samtidig hjerteklaffproblemer. Kardiologisk utredning anbefales får behandling.

Prognose: En 30-Ørs oppfølgingsstudie fant at pasienter med hypokyfose hadde 10 ganger økt risiko for å trenge nakkekirurgi sammenlignet med de med normal kyfose (MDPI, 2022).

Ofte stilte spørsmål: Nei, dette er en vanlig misforståelse. Ryggsåylen skal ha naturlige kurver. En helt rett rygg mangler den naturlige støtdempingen og kan faktisk gi mer plager.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Carpal Tunnel Syndrome: Complete Guide.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Why do my hands go numb at night?

 When you sleep, the wrist is often bent, which significantly increases pressure in
 the carpal tunnel. This compresses the median nerve and causes tingling and numbness. A night splint
 that keeps the wrist in neutral position can help 50-70% of patients.

 

 
 Do I need surgery?

 Not necessarily. Many recover with conservative treatment such as night splint and
 manual therapy. AAOS 2024 recommends trying conservative treatment first. Surgery is considered for
 severe symptoms or no effect after 3-6 months.

 

 
 Can carpal tunnel syndrome go away on its own?

 Mild cases can improve spontaneously, especially if there's a temporary cause
 (like pregnancy). But without treatment, most cases worsen over time. The earlier you start treatment,
 the better the prognosis.

 

 
 Is it dangerous to wait with treatment?

 Long-term, untreated carpal tunnel syndrome can cause permanent nerve damage with
 constant numbness and muscle wasting. Early treatment prevents this.

 

 
 Can I continue working at a computer?

 Yes, but you should consider ergonomic adjustments. Keyboard height, mouse type,
 and frequent breaks are important. An ergonomic assessment can identify problems.

 

 
 What's the difference between carpal tunnel and cubital tunnel?

 Carpal tunnel syndrome affects the median nerve in the wrist and causes symptoms
 in thumb, index, middle and ring finger. Cubital tunnel
 syndrome affects the uln...

Give a brief summary of Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome (SCDS).

Key Summary

 
 What it is: A rare condition where a hole in the bone over the superior semicircular canal causes dizziness and hearing disturbances

 Most common symptoms: Autophony (hearing own voice/heartbeat abnormally loud), sound-induced dizziness, pressure-induced dizziness

 Chiropractor's role: Identify the condition and refer to ENT specialist - vestibular rehabilitation can help after surgery

 Red flags: Dizziness triggered by loud sounds, hearing your own eye movements, pulsatile tinnitus

Describe symptoms and signs of AC Joint Osteoarthritis: Everything You Need to Know.

Symptoms

 

 Symptoms of AC joint osteoarthritis are often characteristic and localized:

 Typical Symptoms

 
 Localized pain: On top of the shoulder, often pinpointable

 Provocation by movements: Reaching across to opposite shoulder (cross-body)

 Pain with overhead: Especially at end range of movement

 Crepitus: Grinding or clicking from the joint

 Night pain: When lying on affected side

 

 
 Activities That Typically Provoke

 
 Bench press and shoulder press

 Dips and push-ups

 Putting on a jacket

 Reaching up to cabinets

 Sleeping on affected side

 
 

 Distinguishing from Other Conditions

 AC joint pain can resemble other shoulder conditions but has some distinctive features:

 
 Signs That Point to the AC Joint

 
 Pain localized directly on top of the shoulder

 Positive cross-body adduction test

 Tenderness on direct palpation over the AC joint

 Pain at end range of overhead movement

 Pain relief with injection into the AC joint

Patient asks: "Do I need an MRI to find out what's wrong?"

Not necessarily. A thorough clinical examination can often distinguish between back and hip problems. MRI is indicated when there is suspicion of serious pathology, neurological deficits, or when conservative treatment doesn't improve symptoms after 6-8 weeks. Many MRI findings (such as degenerative changes) are also found in symptom-free individuals.

How is Trigger Points in the Neck - Muscle Knots and Referred Pain diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 Diagnosis is made through clinical examination. An international Delphi study from 2018 with 60 experts
 from 12 countries concluded that the most important diagnostic criteria are: a taut band in the muscle, a
 hypersensitive point, and reproduction of referred pain with pressure (Fernandez-de-las-Penas & Dommerholt
 2018).

 
 Important to know

 There are no internationally validated diagnostic criteria for MPS. Inter-examiner reliability is only
 moderate. This means that two practitioners examining the same patient may find trigger points in
 slightly different locations. We therefore use the clinical examination as a starting point, but also
 emphasize your experience and response to treatment.

 

 Imaging

 MRI and X-ray are rarely necessary for trigger points. Images often show age-related changes (wear,
 degeneration) that don't explain your pain. Ultrasound can detect trigger points as darker areas with
 increased stiffness, but this is currently mostly used in research.

Røde flagg - når du bør søke lege

 Ring 113 umiddelbart ved
 Alvorlige pustevansker - du får ikke puste ordentlig selv i hvile

 Blalig hud, lepper eller negler (cyanose) - tegn på oksygenmangel

What causes Thumb Arthritis (CMC-1): Complete Guide?

Causes and risk factors

 

 
 Genetics (39-65% hereditary)

 Heredity is by far the most important factor. If your mother has thumb arthritis, your risk is
 significantly increased.

 

 
 Gender

 Women are affected 2-3 times more often than men. Hormones and joint laxity play a role.

 

 
 Age

 Most common after 50, but X-ray findings can be found as early as the 40s.

 

 
 Load

 Heavy manual work and repetitive gripping movements over time increase risk somewhat. This is similar
 to the causation pattern for mouse arm and other overuse conditions in the arm.

Hvorfor gir hullet symptomer?: Det indre øret har normalt to "vinduer" - det ovale vindu der lyd kommer inn, og det runde vindu som gir trykkutligning. Når det oppstår et hull i buegangen, skapes et unormalt "tredje vindu" som endrer hvordan lyd og trykk påvirker balanseorganet.

Hvem rammes?: SCDS debuterer typisk i 40-60 Ørs alder (gjennomsnitt 50 år) og rammer kvinner litt oftere enn menn med et forhold på ca. 1,2:1. Anatomisk dehiscens er bilateral (begge sider) hos opptil 50% av pasientene, men vanligvis er ett øre mer symptomatisk enn det andre.

Symptomer: Forekommer hos 42-43% av pasientene. Høye lyder (typisk 500 Hz-2 kHz ved 100-110 dB) utløser roterende svimmelhet eller ustøhet. Eksempler kan vare høy musikk, hunder som bjeffer, eller stoy fra byggearbeid.

Differensialdiagnoser - hva kan ligne?: SCDS kalles "orets store etterligner" fordi symptomene kan ligne flere andre tilstander
Diagnostikk: Ved mistanke om SCDS kan folgende spørsmål vare avslorende
Behandling: For pasienter med milde til moderate symptomer er konservativ behandling ofte førstevalg. Ca. 80% av diagnostiserte pasienter gjennomgår ikke kirurgi. Konservative tiltak inkluderer
Kiropraktorens rolle ved SCDS: SCDS er en strukturell tilstand som krever spesialistvurdering og eventuelt kirurgisk behandling. Kiropraktoren kan ikke behandle selve tilstanden, men har en viktig rolle i identifisering og henvisning til ONH-spesialist.

Prognose og livskvalitet: Livskvaliteten ved SCDS er betydelig redusert for behandling. Health Utility Values hos preoperative pasienter er 0,68 mot 0,80 i normalbefolkningen. Dizziness Handicap Inventory viser gjennomsnitt 44 poeng, tilsvarende moderat handikap.

Prognose

 

 
 Med behandling: Utsiktene er generelt svært gode. Over 90% oppnår full symptomlindring med riktig behandling. Mange merker betydelig bedring umiddelbart etter reposisjonsmanøveren.

 Tilbakefall

 Det er viktig å være forberedt på at krystallsyke kan komme tilbake:

 
 10-18% får tilbakefall innen ett år

 Ca. 22% innen fem år

 Opp mot 50% over 10 år

 
 Høyere risiko for tilbakefall ses hos personer med migrene, diabetes, høyt blodtrykk, osteoporose og D-vitaminmangel. D-vitamintilskudd kan redusere tilbakefallsrisikoen betydelig.

Røde flagg og gule flagg

 Røde flagg - søk hjelp umiddelbart

 Tap av blære- eller tarmkontroll

 Nummenhet i underlivet (ridebukseanestesi)

 Raskt økende kraftsvikt i bena

 Uforklart vekttap kombinert med ryggsmerter

 Feber og nattlig smerte som ikke bedres av hvile

 Nylig traume med mistanke om brudd

 Kjent kreftsykdom med nye ryggsmerter

 Ring 113 ved mistanke om cauda equina-syndrom .

 Gule flagg - risiko for vedvarende plager

 Gule flagg er psykososiale faktorer som øker risikoen for at akutte ryggsmerter utvikler seg til kroniske
 Bevegelsesunngåelse: Tro på at smerte alltid betyr skade

 Katastrofetanker: "Det kommer aldri til å gå over"

 Passiv mestring: Forventning om at behandling skal "fikse" problemet uten egeninnsats

 Psykiske faktorer: Depresjon, angst eller vedvarende søvnproblemer

 Arbeidsfaktorer: Misnøye med arbeidssituasjonen

 Sosial isolasjon: Mangel på støttende nettverk

 Gule flagg er ikke skyld

 Å identifisere gule flagg handler ikke om å gi noen skylden for smertene sine. Det handler om å finne de faktorene vi kan gjøre noe med for å forebygge at akutte plager blir langvarige.

4Treatment of Headache

 Chiropractic Treatment

 Chiropractic care has documented effect for cervicogenic headache and tension headache with muscular component. A systematic review and meta-analysis showed moderate evidence for spinal manipulation in neck headache.

 
 What I Do

 
 Thorough examination of neck, jaw and shoulder

 Joint mobilization and correction of upper cervical vertebrae

 Soft tissue treatment of trigger points and tight muscles

 Exercises for neck and posture

 Ergonomic advice and preventive strategies

 
 

 Medical Treatment of Migraine

 Migraine often requires medical treatment from a doctor or neurologist.

 
 Acute treatment: Triptans (like sumatriptan) are standard treatment for moderate to severe attacks

 Preventive: Beta-blockers, candesartan, topiramate, amitriptyline

 For chronic migraine: Botox or CGRP inhibitors

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for GTPS - Smerter på Utsiden av Hoften.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Hva er forskjellen på GTPS og trokanter bursitt?

 GTPS er en samlebetegnelse som inkluderer gluteal tendinopati, bursitt og muskeldysfunksjon. Forskning viser at det meste av smertene skyldes seneproblemer, ikke bursitt. Behandlingen er lik uansett.

 

 
 Hvor lang tid tar det å bli bra?

 GTPS tar ofte 6-9 måneder å behandle effektivt. LEAP-studien viste at 79% var bedre etter 1 Ør med riktig treningsbehandling. Varre først er ikke uvanlig.

 

 
 Bør jeg unngå å ligge på den vonde siden?

 Ja, i den akutte fasen. Sideligging komprimerer senene mot trokanter. Bruk en pute mellom knarne eller ligg på den friske siden. Gradvis tilvenning etter hvert som smertene avtar.

 

 
 Hjelper toying?

 Var forsiktig med toying. Mange tøyeØvelser komprimerer senene og kan gjøre vondt verre. Fokuser heller på styrketrening.

 

 
 Kan jeg fortsette å trene?

 Ja, men du må tilpasse treningen. Unngå Øvelser som gir mye smerte, særlig i ytterstillinger. Aktiviteter som sykling og svomming tolereres ofte godt.

Describe The Drawbacks and Risks for Cortisone Injection in Shoulder: Friend or Foe?.

The Drawbacks and Risks

 

 Research in recent years has shown that cortisone isn't as innocent as previously thought. Here's what
 you should know:

 
 Documented risks with repeated use

 
 Tendon weakening: Cortisone inhibits collagen synthesis and can weaken tendon
 tissue over time

 Increased risk of rupture: Studies show increased risk of tendon rupture after
 multiple injections

 Cartilage damage: Cortisone can accelerate cartilage breakdown in joints

 Fat tissue atrophy: Can cause local loss of subcutaneous fat

 Pigment changes: Lighter skin at the injection site

 
 

 Short-lived effect

 One of the biggest limitations is that the effect is often temporary:

 
 
 What research shows

 

 
 At 6-8 weeks, the effect begins to wear off in most people

 At 3 months, there's often no difference from placebo

 At 6-12 months, those who received cortisone may actually have worse outcomes than the control
 group

 The condition often returns if the underlying cause isn't addressed

 
 

 
 "Cortisone flare"

 About 2-5% experience temporary worsening of pain in the first 24-48 hours after injection. This is
 called a "cortisone flare" and is caused by a crystal reaction. It resolves on its own but can be
 uncomfortable.

 

 The problem with tendinopathy

 For chronic tendon irritation (tendinopathy), cortisone is particularly problematic:

 
 Tendinopathy is not primarily an inflammatory condition - it's degenerative

 Cortisone can interfere with the natural repair ...

Beskriv Stol og sittestilling for Skuldervennlig kontorplass: Slik setter du opp arbeidsstasjonen.

Stol og sittestilling

 

 En god stol og riktig justering legger grunnlaget for en avslappet skulderposisjon:

 
 Stolhøyde

 
 Fåttene bør stå flatt i gulvet (eller på fotskammel)

 Knårne bør våre i ca. 90 graders vinkel eller litt mer

 Larene bør våre omtrent parallelle med gulvet

 
 

 
 Armlener

 
 Armlenene bør støtte underarmene slik at skuldrene kan våre avslappet

 Juster høyden slik at skuldrene verken løftes eller trekkes nedover

 Armlenene bør ikke hindre deg i å komme når nok pulten

 Noen foretrekker ingen armlener - da slipper de å sitte for langt fra pulten

 
 

 
 Ryggstotte

 Ryggstotten bør støtte korsryggen (lendaryggen). En god lendestotte hjelper deg å opprettholde naturlig kurvatur i ryggen, noe som igjen gjør det lettere å holde en avslappet skulderposisjon.

 

 
 Den beste sittestillingen

 Viktigere enn "perfekt" stilling er variasjon. Det finnes ikke en posisjon som er ideell i timevis. Bytt mellom å sitte fremoverlent, bakover lent, og oppreist. Reis deg og beveg deg regelmessig. Den neste stillingen er alltid den beste stillingen. Ved vedvarende smerter, vurder om det kan våre en underliggende tilstand som kalkskulder eller TOS (thoracic outlet syndrome).

Forklar prognose for Svimmel når du legger deg? Dette bør du vite om krystallsyke.

Prognose

 Med behandling: Utsiktene er generelt svært gode. Over 90% oppnår full symptomlindring med riktig behandling. Mange merker betydelig bedring umiddelbart etter reposisjonsmanøveren.

 Uten behandling

 Krystallsyke går ofte over av seg selv, men det tar tid: bare 4% er bra etter én uke, 18% etter én måned, og 51% etter ett år. Med tanke på hvor plagsom tilstanden er, gir behandling vesentlig raskere bedring.

 Tilbakefall

 Det er viktig å være forberedt på at krystallsyke kan komme tilbake
 10-18% får tilbakefall innen ett år

 Ca. 22% innen fem år

 Opp mot 50% over 10 år

 Høyere risiko for tilbakefall ses hos personer med migrene, diabetes, høyt blodtrykk, osteoporose og D-vitaminmangel. D-vitamintilskudd kan redusere tilbakefallsrisikoen betydelig.

Describe symptoms and signs of Posterior Canal BPPV: When the World Spins Backwards.

Symptoms

 

 The characteristic symptom of posterior canal BPPV is short, intense episodes of rotational dizziness triggered by specific head movements.

 Typical Triggering Movements:

 
 Lying down in bed

 Rolling over in bed from side to side

 Tilting the head backward (looking up at the ceiling)

 Bending forward to pick something up from the floor

 

 Characteristics of Symptoms:

 
 
 10-60 sec
 Typical duration
 

 
 1-5 sec
 Latency after movement
 

 
 80-90%
 Of BPPV cases
 

 

 
 Accompanying Symptoms

 Nausea, sweating, and unsteadiness are common. BPPV normally does not cause hearing loss, tinnitus (ringing in the ears), or neurological symptoms.

Beskriv Øvelser ved pulten for Skuldervennlig kontorplass: Slik setter du opp arbeidsstasjonen.

Øvelser ved pulten

 

 Disse enkle Øvelsene kan du gjøre sittende ved pulten eller stående ved siden av. De tar bare 30-60 sekunder hver:

 
 1. Skulderruller

 Rull skuldrene bakover i store sirkler. Start med å løfte skuldrene mot orene, deretter trekk dem bakover, ned og frem igjen. Gjenta 10 ganger.

 30 sekunder
 

 
 2. Nakkestretch

 Bøy hodet forsiktig til den ene siden (Øret mot skulderen). Hold i 15-20 sekunder. Gjenta til den andre siden. Ikke roter hodet, bare sidebøyning.

 40 sekunder
 

 
 3. Brystapning

 Len deg tilbake i stolen, Åpne armene ut til sidene og press brystkassen fremover. Klem skulderbladene sammen. Hold i 10 sekunder, gjenta 3 ganger.

 30 sekunder
 

 
 4. Skulderblad-squeeze

 Trekk skulderbladene sammen som om du prøver å holde en blyant mellom dem. Hold i 5 sekunder, slipp. Gjenta 10 ganger.

 50 sekunder
 

 
 5. Hakeinntrending (Chin tuck)

 Trekk haken rett bakover (dobbelhake-bevegelse) mens du ser rett frem. Hold i 5 sekunder. Dette motvirker fremoverlent hodestilling. Gjenta 10 ganger.

 50 sekunder
 

 
 6. Armer over hodet

 Strekk begge armene rett opp over hodet. Pust inn, strekk deg så høyt du kan. Pust ut, senk armene. Gjenta 5 ganger.

 30 sekunder
 

 
 Gjor dette til en vane

 Velg 2-3 av Øvelsene og gjør dem hver gang du tar en mikropause. Over tid blir det automatisk, og skuldrene vil takke deg.

 Kronisk: 15 dager eller mer/måned i over 3 måneder

Beskriv årsaker og risikofaktorer for Osteitis Pubis.

Årsaker og risikofaktorer

 Fra vanligst til sjeldnest
 1. Idrettsrelatert overbelastning (vanligst)

 Fotball, ishockey, rugby, langdistanseloping og andre idretter med sparking, retningsskifte eller repetitiv belastning. Fotballspillere har høyest risiko med 10-18% av skader årlig.

 2. Graviditet og fodsel

 Under graviditet løsner bekkenleddene på grunn av hormonet relaxin. Etter langvarig eller komplisert fodsel kan inflammasjon oppstå, særlig kombinert med muskulær ubalanse.

 3. Bekkenkirurgi (sjeldnest)

 Urologiske eller gynekologiske inngrep kan utlose tilstanden. Forekomsten etter urethropexy-operasjon er 0,7-2,5%.

 Risikofaktorer

 Svak kjerne- og bekkenmuskulatur

 Begrenset hoftebevegelighet

 Rask okning i treningsbelastning

 Tidligere lyskeskader

 Ubalanse mellom adduktor- og abdominalstyrke

Differential diagnoses for Clicking, Locking and Joint Problems in the Jaw?

1. Clicking (Click)

 A clear, distinct sound - like "clicking" your fingers
 Often happens when opening, but can also occur when closing

 Caused by the disc "jumping" back into place

 Opening click: The disc reduces (returns) when opening

 Closing click: The disc displaces again when closing

 Reciprocal clicking: Click both when opening and closing (most common)

2. Crepitation (Grinding/Scraping)

 A continuous, raspy sound - like sand between fingertips
 May indicate wear in the joint surface (osteoarthritis)

 More common in older people

 Not necessarily painful

 Can be stable over a long time

3. Popping (Sudden Snap)

 Loud, sudden sound - like cracking a finger

 Often caused by cavitation (gas bubble in joint fluid)

 Usually harmless

Describe symptoms and causes for Jaw Joint Problems.

Symptoms and Causes

 How does it feel?

 Jaw pain: Deep, aching pain in front of the ear or along the jawline. Worse with
 chewing, yawning or long talking.

 Headache: Affects over half with TMD. Often as pressure behind the eye or a band
 around the temple.

 Ear symptoms: Ear pain, tinnitus or "blocked ear" – without the ear doctor finding
 anything.

 Limited opening: Normal is 40-55 mm (about three fingers vertically).

 Neck pain: Up to 70% of TMD patients have concurrent neck problems.

 Morning stiffness: Common if you clench your teeth at night.

 What causes it?

 Stress and muscle tension

 Go to full article on stress and jaw pain
 ? 

 Most common factor. Under stress, many clench their teeth unconsciously – day and night.

 Poor posture

 Go to full article on text neck and jaw
 ? 

 Forward-leaning head during screen work pulls the jaw backwards and compresses the joint. 76%
 of TMD patients have forward head posture (PMC 2021).

 Teeth grinding (bruxism)

 Go to full article on teeth
 grinding ? 

 8-10% have night-time bruxism (Zielinski 2024). But the connection with TMD pain is more complicated
 than previously thought.

 Neck problems

 Go to full article on neck-jaw
 connection ? 

 Nerve connections between jaw and upper neck (trigeminocervical nucleus) mean that problems in one
 place can cause symptoms in the other.

Myte 7: "Det er bare psykisk"

 Fakta: Svimmelhet er en reell medisinsk tilstand med konkrete fysiske Årsaker. At mange også utvikler angst i forbindelse med svimmelhet er forståelig - frykten for at symptomene skal oppstå på nytt kan være svært belastende.

 Men angst som følge av svimmelhet er ikke det samme som at svimmelheten "bare er psykisk". En grundig undersøkelse vil avdekke om det finnes underliggende vestibulære eller muskuloskeletale Årsaker.

Describe What Can You Do Yourself? for Sinus Headache or Migraine?.

What Can You Do Yourself?

 

 For Migraine

 
 Headache diary: Record attacks, triggers, food, sleep, and menstruation. This helps you identify patterns.

 Regularity: Keep fixed times for sleep, meals, and activity. Migraine brains like predictability. Sleep problems can also cause morning headache.

 Trigger control: Avoid known triggers, but be aware that "trigger hunting" can become excessive.

 Acute treatment: Pain relievers work best when taken early in the attack. Overuse (more than 10-15 days per month) can lead to medication overuse headache.

 

 For Suspected Sinusitis

 
 Saline rinse: Nasal irrigation with saline can relieve symptoms.

 Humid air: Steam inhalation or a humidifier can help with dryness.

 Nasal spray: Decongestant nasal spray for short periods (max 7-10 days for decongestant types).

 Wait and see: Most viral sinusitis resolves in 7-10 days without treatment.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Dizzy and Nauseous - Causes, Treatment and When to Seek Help.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How long does nausea last with dizziness?

 It depends on the cause. With BPPV, nausea typically lasts seconds to minutes after head movement. With vestibular neuritis, nausea can persist for days. With migraine, it can last for hours.

 

 
 Can stress cause dizziness and nausea?

 Yes. Stress and anxiety can cause hyperventilation which causes dizziness. Additionally, 30-50% of dizziness patients are also affected by anxiety or depression - this is a biological connection, not "imagined."

 

 
 Is dizziness and nausea dangerous?

 Usually not. Most causes are benign and treatable. But acute dizziness with neurological symptoms (paralysis, speech difficulties, visual disturbances) can be signs of stroke and requires immediate medical evaluation.

 

 
 What helps against nausea?

 Treat the cause of dizziness. With BPPV, repositioning maneuver gives rapid improvement. During attacks, it can help to lie still, focus on a fixed point, and take deep breaths. Anti-nausea medications can be used short-term but should not be used for more than 2-3 days as they can delay healing.

Describe treatment options for Chiropractor vs Physiotherapist: What's the Difference?.

Treatment Techniques

 

 
 Chiropractor typically uses

 
 Joint manipulation: Quick, precise adjustments of joints

 Joint mobilization: Softer movements of joints

 Soft tissue treatment: Massage and trigger point therapy

 Needling: Dry needling and acupuncture

 Exercises: Individually tailored home exercises

 Shockwave therapy: For tendon conditions

 
 

 
 Physiotherapist typically uses

 
 Exercise therapy: Often main focus

 Manual treatment: Massage and mobilization

 Electrotherapy: TENS, ultrasound, etc.

 Rehabilitation: After injuries and surgeries

 Specialized fields: Neurological, cardiopulmonary, pediatric physiotherapy

 
 

 
 Manual therapists (physiotherapists with additional education) also use joint manipulation.

Describe Differential Diagnoses - What Can It Resemble? for Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome (SCDS).

Differential Diagnoses - What Can It Resemble?

 

 SCDS is called "the great imitator of the ear" because symptoms can resemble several other conditions:

 
 Meniere's Disease

 Also causes hearing loss and dizziness, but attacks come spontaneously and last 20 minutes to several hours. In SCDS, symptoms are temporally related to specific sound or pressure triggers.

 

 
 BPPV (Crystal Disease)

 Triggered by head movements and causes brief spinning dizziness that diminishes with repeated movements. SCDS is triggered by sound and pressure, not head position.

 

 
 Otosclerosis

 Also causes hearing loss in low frequencies, but in otosclerosis the stapedius reflex is absent - in SCDS it is normal. This difference is important because stapedectomy (surgery for otosclerosis) is contraindicated in SCDS.

Beskriv Øvelser for de Første Dagene for Akutt Ryggsmerte: Hva Du Bør Gjøre de Første Timene og Dagene.

Øvelser for de Første Dagene

 

 
 1. Bekkenrulling (Liggende)

 
 Ligg på ryggen med bøyde knær og føttene i gulvet

 Rull bekkenet forsiktig frem (korsryggen flater ut mot underlaget)

 Rull bekkenet tilbake (korsryggen får litt svai)

 10 repetisjoner, 3 ganger daglig

 
 

 
 2. Kne-til-Bryst

 
 Ligg på ryggen med bøyde knær

 Trekk forsiktig ett kne mot brystet

 Hold i 20-30 sekunder

 Bytt side. Gjenta 3 ganger per side.

 
 

 
 3. Cat-Camel

 
 Stå på alle fire med hendene under skuldrene og knærne under hoftene

 Bue ryggen opp mot taket (katt) - slipp hodet ned

 Svaie ryggen ned (kamel) - løft hodet

 Beveg forsiktig gjennom smertefritt område, 10 repetisjoner

 
 

 
 4. Sideliggende Rotasjon

 
 Ligg på siden med bøyde knær

 Roter overkroppen forsiktig mot taket

 Hold i 10 sekunder

 Bytt side

Differential diagnoses for When Dizziness Doesn't Fit: Is It BPPV or Something Else??

1. BPPV/Crystal Disease (17-39% of clinical cases)

 The most common vestibular diagnosis, but far from the only one. Lifetime prevalence in the population is 2.4%, and cumulative risk is approximately 10% by age 80.

 Brief dizziness (seconds) with head movements

 Triggered by lying down, turning over in bed, looking up

 Positive Dix-Hallpike test

 Note: Up to 41% of BPPV patients do NOT have classic spinning sensation. Many describe a "nautical" feeling, unsteadiness, or lightheadedness instead.

2. Vestibular Migraine (6-29% of dizziness patients)

 The second most common cause of recurrent dizziness, and severely underdiagnosed. Only 10% of those meeting diagnostic criteria are told that migraine causes their symptoms. The condition affects 0.98-2.7% of the general population.

 Dizziness episodes lasting minutes to days

 Headache, light/sound sensitivity, or visual disturbances in at least half of attacks

 Previous or current migraine history

 Migraine patients have three times higher risk of developing BPPV

 Important: When repositioning maneuvers don't work after three attempts, vestibular migraine should be strongly suspected.

3. PPPD - Persistent Postural-Perceptual Dizziness (15-20%)

 PPPD is the most common chronic dizziness condition in people aged 30-50. It often develops as a complication of other vestibular conditions - including untreated BPPV.

 Dizziness/unsteadiness most days for at least 3 months

 Worsened by standing upright, movement, and busy visual environments

 Often triggered by a previous vestibular event

 Anxiety worsens the condition

 Approximately 70% of PPPD cases start with a structural vestibular disorder like BPPV.

4. Vestibular Neuritis (3.5-15.5 per 100,000/year)

 Acute inflammation of the balance nerve, often following viral infection.

Describe WAD Classification (Quebec Task Force) for Whiplash.

WAD Classification (Quebec Task Force)

 

 
 
 
 Grade
 Description
 
 
 
 
 WAD 0
 No neck complaints or clinical findings
 
 
 WAD I
 Neck complaints (pain, stiffness, tenderness) without clinical findings

 Neck complaints with musculoskeletal findings (reduced mobility, point tenderness) - most common

 Neck complaints with neurological findings (reduced reflexes, weakness, sensory deficits)

 Fracture or dislocation - requires immediate medical evaluation

Describe symptoms and signs of Vestibular Hypofunction: The Complete Guide.

Symptoms

 

 Symptoms in Unilateral Hypofunction

 
 
 
 Symptom
 Prevalence
 
 
 
 
 Chronic dizziness
 98%
 
 
 Imbalance/unsteadiness
 81%
 
 
 Worsening with head movements
 75%
 
 
 Oscillopsia (unstable vision during movement)
 22-70%
 
 
 Fatigue/exhaustion
 68%
 
 
 

 Symptoms in Bilateral Hypofunction

 Bilateral hypofunction gives a characteristic symptom triad:

 
 1. Unsteadiness When Walking and Standing

 The main complaint, especially on uneven surfaces, in darkness or with head movements. Many describe feeling like they're "walking on a boat."

 

 
 2. Oscillopsia - When the World Jumps

 Often the most bothersome symptom. The visual image "jumps" with head movements. About 70% experience this.

 

 
 3. Symptom-Free at Rest

 Symptoms disappear when you sit or lie still. This distinguishes bilateral hypofunction from other causes.

 

 
 4. No Spinning Dizziness

 Rarely classic vertigo because both sides are equally weak - there is no imbalance creating the sensation of rotation.

 

 
 Red Flags - When You Must Seek Medical Help Immediately

 Call emergency services or go to the emergency room immediately for:

 
 Acute dizziness combined with headache, neck pain or recent trauma

 Speech difficulties, swallowing difficulties or unclear speech

 Paralysis, numbness or weakness in face, arm or leg

 Double vision or visual field loss

 Altered consciousness or confusion

 
 Up to 25% of acute dizziness cases at the emergency room may be caused by stroke ...

Beskriv Hvorfor så mange blir feildiagnostisert for Når svimmelheten ikke passer inn: Er det BPPV eller noe annet?.

Hvorfor så mange blir feildiagnostisert

 

 Feildiagnostisering av svimmelhet er utbredt. På akuttmottak blir 74-81% av perifere vestibulære lidelser (inkludert BPPV) oversett.

 Atypiske BPPV-presentasjoner

 37-41% av BPPV-pasienter har ikke klassisk "alt spinner rundt"-opplevelse. Mange beskriver heller:

 
 Nautisk eller vuggende følelse

 Tåkete tankegang ("brain fog")

 Generell ustadighet mellom anfall

 Vedvarende "lett i hodet"-følelse

 

 Diagnostiske tester har begrensninger

 Dix-Hallpike testen for BPPV har kun 48-88% sensitivitet. Negativ test utelukker ikke diagnosen.

 Overlappende tilstander

 Vestibulær migrene og BPPV kan eksistere samtidig. Migrenepasienter har tre ganger høyere BPPV-risiko, og 25% av vestibulær migrene-pasienter rapporterer posisjonssvimmelhet.

Describe Injury Grading for Ankle Sprains.

Injury Grading

 

 Ankle sprains are classified into three grades based on severity:

 
 
 Grade I (mild)

 Mild stretching, minimal swelling, can bear weight1-3 weeks healing

 

 
 Grade II (moderate)

 Partial tear, moderate swelling, reduced stability3-6 weeks healing

 

 
 Grade III (severe)

 Complete tear, significant instability6-12 weeks or more

 

 

 
 Diagnosis

 Clinical examination is the cornerstone. Ottawa Ankle Rules have 97.6% sensitivity for
 detecting fractures and are used to determine if X-ray is necessary. This approach reduces unnecessary
 X-rays by 30-40%.

 X-ray is only indicated with bone tenderness along the posterior edge of the
 ankle bones or inability to take four steps. With persistent pain after a sprain, stress fracture should be ruled out.

Hva er bekkenleddsmerter i graviditet?: Bekkenleddsmerter i graviditet (PGP - Pelvic Girdle Pain) er smerter i bekkenregionen som oppstår under svangerskapet. Det er en av de vanligste hofte- og bekkenplager gravide opplever.

Behandling: Ja! Kiropraktisk behandling er trygt og effektivt under graviditet når det utføres av en erfaren behandler. Forskning støtter bruk av manuell behandling for bekkensmerter i svangerskapet.

Etter fodsel: De fleste opplever betydelig bedring i løpet av de første månedene etter fodsel. Hormonnivåene normaliseres og bekkenet gjenvinner stabiliteten.

Describe symptoms and signs of Bra Strap Syndrome and Shoulder Pain.

Symptoms

 

 The typical symptom pattern has a characteristic pattern:

 
 Typical Symptoms

 
 Shoulder and neck pain - often on both sides, but can be worse on one side

 Pain is minimal in the morning and gradually worsens throughout the day

 Relief when the bra is removed - this is an important diagnostic sign

 Numbness or tingling down the arm (due to nerve compression)

 Visible grooves or marks where the straps sit

 Headache - often from the back of the head and upward

 Fatigue in the shoulders, especially during prolonged standing or carrying bags

 
 

 
 Important Diagnostic Sign

 Symptom relief when the bra is removed, and worsening throughout the day, distinguishes bra strap
 syndrome from other shoulder/neck problems.

Describe causes and risk factors for Text Neck and Phone Neck.

Causes and Risk Factors

 Prolonged screen use in forward-bent position (most common)

 The clearly most common cause of text neck is simply the time spent with the head bent over the phone, tablet or PC. A meta-analysis from 2025 found that excessive smartphone use gives 2.34 times higher risk of neck pain. Among office workers, the risk was even higher - 6 times increased risk .

 Poor workplace ergonomics

 Screen placed too low, chair without support, or lack of height adjustment contributes to the neck being held in unfavorable positions hour after hour.

 Lack of breaks and movement

 Static work without micro-breaks overloads the neck musculature. Health guidelines recommend varied activity, different work positions and frequent micro-breaks.

Describe treatment options for Eagle Syndrome.

Treatment

 

 Conservative treatment

 Can be tried as first measure:

 
 Conservative options

 
 Pain relievers: NSAIDs

 Lack of response to conservative treatment

 Severe symptoms

 Prognosis after surgery

 
 80-90% report significant improvement

 Complications are rare with experienced surgeons

 Symptom relief is often achieved within weeks after surgery

Provide a structured clinical overview of Cluster Headache: The Most Intense Pain.

What is Cluster Headache?: Cluster headache belongs to a group of headaches called trigeminal autonomic cephalalgias (TACs) . The condition was first described by the Norwegian neurologist Ottar Sjaastad at St. Olavs Hospital in Trondheim.

Symptoms: Attacks typically last 15-180 minutes if untreated, with an average of 45-90 minutes (ICHD-3, 2018).

Episodic vs. Chronic Form: Episodic cluster headache (80-90% of cases): Attacks come in periods ("clusters") of 2 weeks to 3 months, followed by at least 3 months of pain-free remission.

Why Does Cluster Headache Occur?: Research points to the hypothalamus - the brain's biological clock - as the main cause. A groundbreaking PET study from 1998 (May et al., The Lancet) showed activation of the hypothalamus during attacks. This explains why attacks follow circadian and seasonal patterns so precisely.

Diagnosis: Cluster headache is diagnosed primarily through thorough medical history. The diagnostic criteria from ICHD-3 (2018) require
Treatment: 100% pure oxygen at least 12-15 liters/minute through a non-rebreathing mask for 15-20 minutes.

What Can the Chiropractor Do?: Let me be honest: Chiropractic does not treat cluster headache. This is a neurological disease in the hypothalamus that requires specific medical treatment.

Describe symptoms and signs of Cervical Foraminal Stenosis - Narrowed Nerve Canal in Neck.

Symptoms

 

 Typical Symptoms

 
 Radicular pain: Sharp, burning, or electric pain that radiates from neck to arm
 

 Numbness and tingling: Often in specific fingers depending on which nerve is
 affected

 Weakness: Reduced strength in specific arm or hand muscles

 Neck stiffness: Especially with movements that close the foramen (extension +
 rotation toward painful side)

 

 
 Spurling's Test

 A classic test for foraminal stenosis: The head
 is bent backward and rotated toward the painful side, then light pressure is applied downward. A
 positive test reproduces radiation to the arm. This "closes" the foramen and provokes symptoms.

Describe causes and risk factors for Headache on Top of the Head.

Causes and Risk Factors

 Tension Headache

 Most common - 46% lifetime 

 Tension headache is by far the most common cause of headache on top of the head. Lifetime prevalence is 46% globally, and Danish studies show up to 78%. Women are affected twice as often as men.

 Typical presentation is bilateral, pressing or tightening pain - often described as a "band around the head" that can focus on the top. The pain is mild to moderate and does not worsen with physical activity.

 Risk factors: Stress, poor sleep, prolonged screen work and static work postures.

 Trigger Points in Neck Musculature

 Referred pain 

 Muscles in the neck can refer pain to the top of the head through a phenomenon called "referred pain." Read more about trigger points and headache .

 Splenius capitis is the primary muscle that sends pain specifically to the crown. Trigger points in this muscle - located approximately at the C3 level - create a characteristic pain sensation in a 3-5 cm zone in the middle of the top of the head. Patients often describe this as "internal head pain" or "pressure on the crown."

 Suboccipital muscles (the small muscles at the very top of the neck) are found to have active trigger points in 65% of patients with chronic tension headache. These muscles have a direct anatomical connection to the meninges.

 Cervicogenic Headache

 2.5-4.1% of population 

 Cervicogenic headache is caused by dysfunction in the upper cervical vertebrae (C1-C3) and surrounding structures. The Norwegian Vaga study found 4.1% prevalence.

 This type of headache typically starts in the neck and radiates upward toward the top of the head on one side. The pain worsens with neck movements and sustained postures.

 Occipital Neuralgia

 Rare 

 Occipital neuralgia causes sharp, shooting pain from the back of the head that can radiate to the top of the head. The pain follows the course of the occipital nerve and is often unilateral with periods of intense "lightning-like" pain.

Describe diagnosis for Vestibular Migraine: When Dizziness Takes Over.

Diagnosis

 Barany Society/IHS Diagnostic Criteria

 For a diagnosis of "Definite Vestibular Migraine," the following must be met
 At least 5 episodes with vestibular symptoms of moderate to severe intensity

 Duration from 5 minutes to 72 hours

 Current or previous history of migraine (with or without aura)

 At least 50% of attacks must have at least one migraine feature: headache, light/sound sensitivity, or visual aura

 Symptoms cannot be better explained by another diagnosis

 Differential Diagnosis

 Condition 
 Duration 
 Key Features 

 Vestibular migraine 
 Minutes to hours 
 Migraine features, gradual onset 

 BPPV (crystals) 
 Seconds 
 Abrupt onset, specific head position 

 Meniere's disease 
 Hours 
 Progressive hearing loss, unilateral fullness 

 Vestibular neuritis 
 Days 
 Single episode, gradual improvement 

 Red Flags - Seek Medical Attention For
 Sudden, intense headache ("the worst headache of my life")

 Headache with fever and neck stiffness

 Unilateral hearing loss or tinnitus

 Double vision or vision loss

 Weakness or numbness in face, arm, or leg

 Speech or language difficulties

 Fainting in connection with dizziness

Describe What is thumb arthritis? for Thumb Arthritis (CMC-1): Complete Guide.

What is thumb arthritis?

 

 Thumb arthritis (CMC-1 arthritis, basal arthritis) is osteoarthritis in the joint at the base of the
 thumb - where the thumb meets the first metacarpal bone (carpometacarpal joint). This joint is
 particularly vulnerable because it gives the thumb its unique mobility, but also exposes it to great
 strain. The condition is sometimes confused with De Quervain's
 tenosynovitis or trigger finger, which also cause thumb problems.
 

 The joint has a "saddle shape" that allows movement in multiple planes. This enables gripping and
 squeezing powerfully, but also makes the joint unstable and vulnerable to wear over time.

 more often in women
 

 
 72%
 of findings are asymptomatic

Describe treatment options for Runner's Knee (PFPS) - How to Return to Full Distance.

Treatment

 

 Treatment of runner's knee focuses on addressing the underlying causes, not just the symptoms:

 1. Hip strengthening

 
 Key exercises

 
 Side-lying hip abduction: Focus on gluteus medius

 Clamshells: With resistance band for increased load

 Single-leg bridging: Functional hip activation

 Step-downs: Eccentric control

 
 

 2. Quadriceps strengthening

 Strengthening the quadriceps is important, but start in pain-free ranges and progress gradually to more
 knee flexion.

 3. Running form adjustments

 
 Increase cadence by 5-10%

 One of the well-documented single interventions! Higher cadence gives:

 
 Shorter stride length

 Less vertical force per step

 Reduced load on the patellofemoral joint

 
 Practical tip: Use a metronome app or run to music with the right BPM. Measure your
 current cadence first, then increase gradually.

 

 4. Load management

 
 Pain scale 0-10

 During running: Keep pain below 3/10

 After running: Pain should return to baseline within 24 hours

 If not - train a bit less next time

 

 5. Manual treatment

 
 Chiropractic care may include

 
 Mobilization of patella and knee joint

 Soft tissue techniques for tight muscles

 Treatment of hip and ankle

 Kinesio taping to support the kneecap

Hva forårsaker ICR syndrom?

Typer og Årsaker

 

 Smerter fra carotisregionen kan ha flere Årsaker, fra godartede til livstruende:

 
 
 Carotisdisseksjon

 ALVORLIG
 

 En rift i arterieveggen som fører til blodansamling (hematom) i veggen. Dette innsnevrer arterien og kan føre til hjerneslag.

 
 Kan oppstå spontant eller etter nakketraume/manipulasjon

 Gir ofte ensidig hals-/hodepine med Horners syndrom

 Høy risiko for iskemisk hjerneslag

Describe causes and risk factors for Mal de Debarquement Syndrome.

Causes and Risk Factors

 Triggering Factors - From Most Common to Rarest

 Motion-Triggered MdDS (Most Common)

 Cruise or boat travel - by far the most common trigger

 Air travel

 Long car journey or train ride

 Elevator ride or walking on a pier

 Temporary "mal de debarquement" after sea travel occurs in 73-86% of people, even among experienced sailors. Longer trips and rough seas can increase the risk, but the duration of exposure does not seem to determine severity.

 Spontaneous/Non-Motion-Triggered MdDS (Rarer)

 Hormonal changes - studies show that ~44% had symptom onset during perimenopause or menopause

 Psychological stress or major life events

 Surgical procedures

 Head injury

 Without identifiable cause

 Who Is Affected?

 MdDS has a clear demographic profile
 Women make up 80-90% of cases

 Average onset age: 43-50 years

 Sex ratio: Women:men approximately 9:1

 Migraine: People with migraine have increased risk of developing MdDS. These patients may also experience vestibular migraine

Klinisk resonnering:
- Smerter er reproduserbare = mekanisk komponent bekreftet
- Normal pust og SpO2 = ingen pneumothorax/lungepatologi

- Ved ENHVER fokal ømhet over processus spinosus → røntgen

HANDLING: Forsiktig behandling. Røntgen thorakalcolumna anbefales pga. traumemekanisme. Revurder om 3-5 dager.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Sports Injuries - Complete Guide.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How soon after injury should I seek treatment?

 For acute injuries, assessment within the first few days is ideal. Early intervention can speed recovery and prevent complications. For overuse injuries, seek help when pain affects your training or doesn't improve with modified activity.

 

 
 Can I continue training with a sports injury?

 Often yes, with modifications. Many injuries allow continued training at reduced intensity or with alternative activities. Complete rest is rarely necessary and can actually delay recovery. A chiropractor can guide appropriate modifications.

 

 
 Should I use ice or heat on my injury?

 For acute injuries (first 48-72 hours), ice can help manage pain and swelling. After the acute phase, heat may help with muscle relaxation. However, active movement and appropriate loading are more important than either.

 

 
 Do I need imaging for my sports injury?

 Not always. A thorough clinical examination often provides sufficient information to start treatment. Imaging may be recommended if there's suspected fracture, complete ligament tear, or if symptoms don't improve as expected.

 

 
 How do I know when I'm ready to return to sport?

 Return to sport should be based on function, not time. You should have full pain-free range of motion, adequate strength (usually 90%+ of uninjured side), and be able to perform sport-specific movements without symptoms.

 

 
 How can I prevent re-injury?

 Complete your rehab...

Beskriv Frossen skulder (adhesiv kapsulitt) for Skuldersmerter – Komplett guide.

Frossen skulder (adhesiv kapsulitt)

 

 Frossen skulder er en tilstand der leddkapselen rundt skulderen blir tykk, betent og stram. Det fører til gradvis Økende stivhet og smerte. Tilstanden går gjennom tre karakteristiske faser:

 
 Frysefasen (2-9 måneder)

 Gradvis Økende smerte og stivhet. Nattesmertene kan våre intense.

 

 
 Frossen fase (4-12 måneder)

 Smertene avtar noe, men stivheten er på sitt verste. Daglige aktiviteter blir vanskelige.

 

 
 Opptiningsfasen (6-24 måneder)

 Bevegeligheten kommer gradvis tilbake. Full bedring kan ta 1-3 Ør.

 

 
 Hvem får frossen skulder?

 Diabetes Øker risikoen betydelig å diabetikere har 5 ganger høyere sannsynlighet for å utvikle frossen skulder. Andre risikofaktorer er skjoldbruskkjertellidelser og langvarig inaktivitet etter skade eller operasjon.

 

 
 Prognose: Selv om det tar tid, gjenvinner 80% av pasientene god skulderfunksjon med riktig oppfølging. Tidlig behandling kan redusere alvorlighetsgrad og varighet.

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Krum Rygg og Dårlig Holdning.

Symptomer å mer enn bare utseende

 

 Krum rygg handler ikke bare om hvordan du ser ut. Mange opplever en rekke plager som de ikke kobler til holdningen:

 Nakke- og skulderproblemer

 Økt brystkrumning tvinger hodet fremover for å opprettholde horisontalt blikk. Dette overbelaster nakkemuskler og ledd, noe som kan føre til smerter mellom skulderbladene. Forskning viser at forward head posture medierer forholdet mellom brystkyfose og nedsatt nakkebevegelighet. Granito et al. (2012) dokumenterte at redusert brystmobilitet korrelerte med 23% redusert skulderbevegelighet.

 Hodepine

 Watson og Trott (1993) fant at 83% av pasienter med cervikogen hodepine hadde Økt brystkyfose (>40 grader). En studie fra 2023 på migrenepasienter viste signifikant høyere kyfosevinkel (57 grader vs 38 grader) sammenlignet med friske kontroller. Hodepinen kommer ofte fra overbelastede nakkestrukturer som kompenserer for brystkrumningen.

 Armsmerter og nummenhet

 Stiv brystrygg kan påvirke skulderbladsposisjon og nervefunksjon. En studie fant at 78% av tilfeller med tennisalbue eller golfalbue hadde samtidig stiv brystrygg. Nummenhet og prikking i hendene kan skyldes kompresjon eller strekk av nerver i den kinetiske kjeden.

 Tretthet og nedsatt funksjon

 å holde kroppen oppreist mot en krum rygg krever konstant muskelarbeid. Mange opplever uforklarlig tretthet. Ved alvorlig kyfose kan lungefunksjonen påvirkes fordi brystkassen komprimeres. For mer om sammenhengen mellom pust og rygg, se pust, ...

Describe why can't the doctor find a cause? for Non.

Why can't the doctor find a cause?

 MRI doesn't show everything - and shows too much

 An important study by Brinjikji and colleagues (AJNR 2015) examined MRI scans of people with no back pain at all. The findings were striking
 MRI Finding 
 20-year-olds without pain 
 80-year-olds without pain 

 Disc degeneration 
 37% 
 96% 

 Disc bulging 
 30% 
 84% 

 This means that much of what MRI shows is normal age-related change . Degeneration in 37% of 20-year-olds without pain (Brinjikji et al., AJNR 2015) and disc bulging from 30% at age 20 to 84% at age 80 - all without symptoms (Brinjikji et al., AJNR 2015). Wear, bulging and degeneration are just as common in healthy backs as in painful ones.

 This is why all international guidelines recommend against routine MRI for lower back pain without red flags (WHO 2023). Unnecessary imaging can actually make things worse: terms like "wear and tear", "degeneration" and "herniation" can create fear and avoidance behaviour - even when the findings are completely normal for the person's age.

 When is MRI appropriate?

 Imaging is considered when red flags are present, with progressive neurological deficits, or when there is no improvement after 6-12 weeks of adequate treatment. Clinical examination is usually sufficient to start treatment.

 Pain is more than tissue damage

 Modern research has shown that pain is a complex phenomenon influenced by far more than tissue damage alone. The biopsychosocial model views pain as an interplay between three domains
 Biological factors

 Muscle tension, joint stiffness, deconditioning, inflammation and sleep deprivation. These factors are real and treatable.

 Psychological factors

 Thoughts and emotions affect the pain experience. Fear of movement (kinesiophobia), catastrophic thinking and low self-efficacy can amplify and perpetuate pain. This is not about the pain being psychological - but about the brain regulating the pain experience.

Phase 3 (weeks 8-12)

 Sport-specific training, rotational exercises, single-leg exercises, plyometrics and speed training.
 Gradual return to full activity.

 

 Treatment timeline

 Conservative treatment typically takes 9-18.5 weeks for return to sport. The Holmich
 protocol achieved 79% return to previous sport level after a median of 18.5 weeks. The modified protocol
 showed 86.6% success after an average of 12 weeks.

 When is surgery appropriate?

 Surgery is reserved for patients who do not respond to 2-6 months of adequate conservative treatment.
 Surgical results are good: 97% return to sport in the surgery group versus 50% in the conservative group
 at 12 months - in patients with confirmed defects.

Assess red flags: 25-year-old male with back pain after CrossFit. Feels warm, measured temp 37.6C. Diffuse muscle soreness throughout back. No focal percussion tenderness. Started yesterday.

URGENCY: SAFE

No red flags identified.

Clinical reasoning — why this is NOT spinal infection:
- Temp 37.6C is subclinical and common after intense exercise (exercise-induced hyperthermia)
- Spinal infection causes fever >38C, typically with night sweats
- DIFFUSE muscle soreness (DOMS) vs. FOCAL percussion tenderness in infection
- No risk factors (IV drug use, immunosuppression, recent surgery)
- Acute onset after clear mechanical trigger

Clinical picture: Delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS) with mild hyperthermia.

Safe to treat. Rest, hydration, gradual return to activity.

Explain exercises you can do at home for Chronic Dizziness and PPPD.

Exercises You Can Do at Home

 Gaze Stabilization Exercises (VOR x1)

 Hold a finger or a letter at arm's length

 Focus on the target

 Move your head slowly from side to side while keeping your gaze on the target

 Start with 10 repetitions, 3 times daily

 Gradually increase speed over weeks

 Balance Exercises

 Level 1 - Romberg: Stand with feet together, arms at sides, hold for 30 seconds. Progression: Open eyes - Closed eyes - Soft surface

 Level 2 - Tandem stance: Stand with one foot in front of the other (heel-to-toe), hold for 30 seconds on each side

 Level 3 - Single leg stance: Stand on one leg, goal: 30 seconds on each side

 Important Principles

 Consistency is key: Daily practice gives better results than intense, sporadic training

 Mild symptom provocation is the goal: Exercises should cause mild-moderate dizziness that resolves within 15-20 minutes

 Document progress: Keep a diary of symptoms and exercises

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Menieres Sykdom.

Symptomer

 

 De klassiske symptomene:

 
 1. Vertigo (rotasjonssvimmelhet)

 
 Plutselige, intense anfall der verden "snurrer"

 Varighet typisk fra 20 minutter til 12 timer

 Ofte ledsaget av kvalme og oppkast

 
 

 
 2. Hørselstap

 
 Svingende, sensorinevralt Hørselstap

 Rammer typisk de lave frekvensene først ("bass-tap")

 Kan vare midlertidig i starten, men blir ofte permanent over tid

 
 

 
 3. Tinnitus (Øresus)

 
 Vanligvis lavfrekvent, "brummende" eller "susende" lyd

 Kan bli sterkere for og under anfall

 Blir ofte konstant etter hvert

 
 

 I tillegg opplever mange trykkfølelse eller "fylde" i det affiserte Øret, aura for anfall (endret Øresus, Økende trykk), og ekstrem utmattelse etter anfall.

 Sykdommens faser

 
 Tidlig fase: Intense vertigo-anfall. Horselen normaliseres ofte mellom anfallene

 Mellomfase: Anfallene fortsetter. Horselstapet blir mer permanent. Tinnitus blir ofte konstant

 Sen fase ("burn-out"): De voldsomme svimmelhetsanfallene avtar eller forsvinner. Ca. 34% opplever spontan remisjon fra episodisk vertigo

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for When Orthotics Actually Help.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Who benefits from orthotics?

 Patients with diabetic neuropathy, rheumatoid arthritis and symptomatic pes cavus have strong evidence for benefit. Additionally, orthotics can be used temporarily for acute injuries and postoperative rehabilitation.

 

 
 Are custom orthotics worth the price?

 For most conditions, research shows no difference between custom and prefabricated orthotics. The exception is complex deformities or special medical needs where precise customization is critical.

 

 
 Do orthotics work for overpronation?

 Evidence is weak. Large studies (Nielsen 2013) showed no difference in injury rates when runners got shoes matched to foot type versus neutral shoes. "Overpronation" as a diagnosis lacks scientific basis.

 

 
 Can I wean off orthotics?

 Yes, for many people gradual weaning combined with foot exercises is a good alternative. But it should be done gradually over several months. If you have diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis or severe deformities, you should continue with orthotics.

 

 
 Why do so many prescribe orthotics without evidence?

 Several factors are at play: tradition, commercial interests, and genuine misunderstandings about foot biomechanics. Many practitioners learned that orthotics were standard treatment - research has since shown this is often not the case.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Anterior Canal BPPV: The Rare Variant.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can anterior canal BPPV be confused with neck-related dizziness?

 Yes, this is a common differential diagnosis. A positive response to the Supine Head Hanging Test with characteristic downbeat nystagmus suggests anterior canal BPPV. Cervicogenic dizziness typically produces no specific nystagmus.

 

 
 Why is anterior canal BPPV so rare?

 The anterior canal's vertical orientation makes it difficult for crystals to enter the canal against gravity. The same orientation also promotes spontaneous drainage of any crystals.

 

 
 Is downbeat nystagmus always anterior canal BPPV?

 No. Downbeat nystagmus can also be caused by central causes (cerebellar disease), apogeotropic posterior canal BPPV, or vestibular migraine. Correct differential diagnosis is essential.

 

 
 Can I get anterior canal BPPV after treatment for posterior canal BPPV?

 Yes, this is called canal conversion and can occur when crystals move to another canal during treatment.
